verses.textEn: Then Joshua spoke to the Lord, on the day that he handed over the Amorite in the sight of the sons of Israel, and he said before them: “O sun, you shall not move toward Gibeon! O moon, you shall not move toward the valley of Aijalon!”
verses.textLa: Tunc locutus est Iosue Domino in die, qua tradidit Amorrhæum in conspectu filiorum Israel, dixitque coram eis: Sol contra Gabaon ne movearis, et Luna contra vallem Aialon.

verses.textEn: And the sun and the moon stood still, until the people had avenged themselves of their enemies. Has this not been written in the book of the just? And so the sun stood still in the midst of heaven, and it did not hurry to its rest for the space of one day.
verses.textLa: Steteruntque Sol et Luna, donec ulcisceretur se gens de inimicis suis. Nonne scriptum est hoc in libro iustorum? Stetit itaque Sol in medio cæli, et non festinavit occumbere spatio unius diei.
verses.notes: It is contrary to the Catholic faith to claim that this passage describes an eclipse of the sun; that is not at all what the text says. But neither is it necessary to say that the passage implies that the earth is the center of the solar system, or that the sun, earth, and moon ceased to move for 24 hours. Some type of miracle occurred, so that the sun and moon appeared to remain in the same place in the sky, but we are not told exactly how this was accomplished. Also, one need not hold that the one day was 24 hours; it could have been some shorter length of time, since the Jews counted a partial day as one day.

verses.textEn: Never before and never after was there so long a day, as when the Lord obeyed the voice of a man, and fought for Israel.
verses.textLa: Non fuit antea nec postea tam longa dies, obediente Domino voci hominis, et pugnante pro Israel.

verses.textEn: And Joshua returned, with all of Israel, into the camp of Gilgal.
verses.textLa: Reversusque est Iosue cum omni Israel in castra Galgalæ.

verses.textEn: For the five kings had fled, and had hidden themselves in a cave, near the city of Makkedah.
verses.textLa: Fugerant enim quinque reges, et se absconderant in spelunca urbis Maceda.

verses.textEn: And it was reported to Joshua that the five kings had been found hidden in a cave, near the city of Makkedah.
verses.textLa: Nunciatumque est Iosue quod inventi essent quinque reges latentes in spelunca urbis Maceda.

verses.textEn: And he instructed his companions and said: “Roll vast stones to the mouth of the cave, and station attentive men who will keep them closed.
verses.textLa: Qui præcepit sociis, et ait: Volvite saxa ingentia ad os speluncæ, et ponite viros industrios, qui clausos custodiant:

verses.textEn: But as for you, do not stay here; instead, pursue the enemies, and cut down the lattermost of those who are fleeing. You shall not permit those whom the Lord God has delivered into your hands to enter into the protection of their cities.”
verses.textLa: vos autem nolite stare, sed persequimini hostes, et extremos quosque fugientium cædite: nec dimittatis eos urbium suarum intrare præsidia, quos tradidit Dominus Deus in manus vestras.

verses.textEn: Thus, the adversaries were struck down in a great defeat, and having been nearly consumed, even to utter annihilation, those who were able to escape from Israel entered into fortified cities.
verses.textLa: Cæsis ergo adversariis plaga magna, et usque ad internecionem pene consumptis, hi, qui Israel effugere potuerunt, ingressi sunt civitates munitas.

verses.textEn: And the entire army returned to Joshua at Makkedah, where they were then encamped, in good health and in their full numbers. And no one dared to move his tongue against the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Reversusque est omnis exercitus ad Iosue in Maceda, ubi tunc erant castra, sani et integro numero: nullusque contra filios Israel mutire ausus est.

verses.textEn: And Joshua instructed, saying, “Open the mouth of the cave, and bring forward to me the five kings, who are hidden within it.”
verses.textLa: Præcepitque Iosue, dicens: Aperite os speluncæ, et producite ad me quinque reges, qui in ea latitant.

verses.textEn: And the ministers did just as they had been ordered. And they led out to him the five kings from the cave: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, the king of Eglon.
verses.textLa: Feceruntque ministri ut sibi fuerat imperatum: et eduxerunt ad eum quinque reges de spelunca, regem Ierusalem, regem Hebron, regem Ierimoth, regem Lachis, regem Eglon.

verses.textEn: And when they had been led out to him, he called all the men of Israel, and he said to the leaders of the army who were with him, “Go, and place your feet upon the necks of these kings.” And when they had gone and had tread their feet upon the necks of those who were thrown down,
verses.textLa: Cumque educti essent ad eum, vocavit omnes viros Israel, et ait ad principes exercitus qui secum erant: Ite, et ponite pedes super colla regum istorum. Qui cum perrexissent, et subiectorum colla pedibus calcarent,

verses.textEn: he spoke to them again: “Do not be afraid, and do not dread. Be strengthened and be steadfast. For so will the Lord do to all your enemies, against whom you fight.”
verses.textLa: rursum ait ad eos: Nolite timere, nec paveatis, confortamini et estote robusti: sic enim faciet Dominus cunctis hostibus vestris, adversum quos dimicatis.

verses.textEn: And Joshua struck them down and killed them, and he suspended them on five gallows. And they hung there until evening.
verses.textLa: Percussitque Iosue, et interfecit eos, atque suspendit super quinque stipites: fueruntque suspensi usque ad vesperum.

verses.textEn: And when the sun had set, he instructed his assistants that they should take them down from the gallows. And having been taken down, they cast them into the cave, where they had lain hidden, and they set vast stones at its mouth, which remain, even to the present.
verses.textLa: Cumque occumberet Sol, præcepit sociis ut deponerent eos de patibulis. Qui depositos proiecerunt in speluncam, in qua latuerant, et posuerunt super os eius saxa ingentia, quæ permanent usque in præsens.

verses.textEn: Also on the same day, Joshua seized Makkedah, and he struck it with the edge of the sword, and he put to death its king and all its inhabitants. He did not leave in it even the smallest remains. And he did to the king of Makkedah, just as he had done to the king of Jericho.
verses.textLa: Eodem quoque die Macedam cepit Iosue, et percussit eam in ore gladii, regemque illius interfecit, et omnes habitatores eius: non dimisit in ea saltem parvas reliquias. Fecitque regi Maceda, sicut fecerat regi Iericho.

verses.textEn: Then he went on, with all of Israel, from Makkedah to Libnah, and he fought against it.
verses.textLa: Transivit autem cum omni Israel de Maceda in Lebna, et pugnabat contra eam:

verses.textEn: And the Lord delivered it, with its king, into the hands of Israel. And they struck the city with the edge of the sword, and all its inhabitants. They did not leave in it any remains. And they did to the king of Libnah, just as they had done to the king of Jericho.
verses.textLa: quam tradidit Dominus cum rege suo in manus Israel: percusseruntque urbem in ore gladii, et omnes habitatores eius. Non dimiserunt in ea ullas reliquias. Feceruntque regi Lebna, sicut fecerant regi Iericho.

verses.textEn: From Libnah, with all of Israel, he went on to Lachish. And taking positions around it with his army, he besieged it.
verses.textLa: De Lebna transivit in Lachis cum omni Israel: et exercitu per gyrum disposito oppugnabat eam.

verses.textEn: And the Lord delivered Lachish into the hands of Israel, and he seized it on the following day, and he struck it with the edge of the sword, and every soul that was in it, just as he had done to Libnah.
verses.textLa: Tradiditque Dominus Lachis in manus Israel, et cepit eam die altero, atque percussit in ore gladii, omnemque animam quæ fuerat in ea, sicut fecerat Lebna.

verses.textEn: At that time, Horam, the king of Gezer, went up so that he might assist Lachish. And Joshua struck him with all his people, even unto utter annihilation.
verses.textLa: Eo tempore ascendit Horam rex Gazer, ut auxiliaretur Lachis: quem percussit Iosue cum omni populo eius usque ad internecionem.

verses.textEn: And he went on from Lachish to Eglon, and he surrounded it.
verses.textLa: Transivitque de Lachis in Eglon, et circumdedit,

verses.textEn: And he also defeated it on the same day. And he struck all the souls that were in it with the edge of the sword, in accord with all that he had done to Lachish.
verses.textLa: atque expugnavit eam eadem die: percussitque in ore gladii omnes animas, quæ erant in ea iuxta omnia quæ fecerat Lachis.

verses.textEn: He also ascended, with all of Israel, from Eglon into Hebron, and he fought against it.
verses.textLa: Ascendit quoque cum omni Israel de Eglon in Hebron, et pugnavit contra eam:

verses.textEn: He seized it and struck it with the edge of the sword, likewise with its king, and all the towns of that region, and all the souls that were staying in it. He did not leave any remains in it. Just as he had done to Eglon, so also did he do to Hebron, consuming with the sword all that he found within it.
verses.textLa: cepit eam, et percussit in ore gladii, regem quoque eius, et omnia oppida regionis illius, universasque animas, quæ in ea fuerant commoratæ: non reliquit in ea ullas reliquias: sicut fecerat Eglon, sic fecit et Hebron, cuncta quæ in ea reperit consumens gladio.

verses.textEn: Returning from there to Debir,
verses.textLa: Inde reversus in Dabir,

verses.textEn: he seized it and laid waste to it, likewise with its king. And all the surrounding towns, he struck with the edge of the sword. He did not leave in it any remains. Just as he had done to Hebron and Libnah, and to their kings, so did he do to Debir and to its king.
verses.textLa: cepit eam atque vastavit: regem quoque eius atque omnia per circuitum oppida percussit in ore gladii: non dimisit in ea ullas reliquias: sicut fecerat Hebron et Lebna et regibus earum, sic fecit Dabir et regi illius.

verses.textEn: And so Joshua struck the entire land, the mountains, and the south, and the plains, and the descending slopes, with their kings. He did not leave in it any remains, but he put to death all that was able to breathe, just as the Lord, the God of Israel, had instructed him,
verses.textLa: Percussit itaque Iosue omnem Terram montanam et meridianam atque campestrem, et Asedoth cum regibus suis: non dimisit in ea ullas reliquias, sed omne quod spirare poterat interfecit, sicut præceperat ei Dominus Deus Israel,

verses.textEn: from Kadesh-barnea, as far as Gaza, with all the land of Goshen, as far as Gibeon.
verses.textLa: a Cadesbarne usque Gazam. Omnem Terram Gosen usque Gabaon,

verses.textEn: And all their kings and their regions, he seized and destroyed with a single attack. For the Lord, the God of Israel, fought on his behalf.
verses.textLa: universosque reges, et regiones eorum uno impetu cepit atque vastavit: Dominus enim Deus Israel pugnavit pro eo.

verses.textEn: And he returned, with all of Israel, to the place of the encampment at Gilgal.
verses.textLa: Reversusque est cum omni Israel ad locum castrorum in Galgala.

verses.textEn: And when Jabin, the king of Hazor, had heard these things, he sent to Jobab, the king of Madon, and to the king of Shimron, and to the king of Achshaph,
verses.textLa: Quæ cum audisset Iabin rex Asor, misit ad Iobab regem Madon, et ad regem Semeron, atque ad regem Achsaph:

verses.textEn: also to the kings of the north, who were living in the mountains, and in the plains opposite the southern region of Chinneroth, and also in the plains and the regions of Dor, beside the sea,
verses.textLa: ad reges quoque Aquilonis, qui habitabant in montanis et in planitie contra meridiem Ceneroth, in campestribus quoque et in regionibus Dor iuxta mare:

verses.textEn: also to the Canaanites, from east to west, and to the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Jebusite in the mountains, also to the Hivite who was living at the base of Hermon, in the land of Mizpah.
verses.textLa: Chananæum quoque ab Oriente et Occidente, et Amorrhæum atque Hethæum ac Pherezæum et Iebusæum in montanis: Hevæum quoque qui habitabat ad radices Hermon in Terra Maspha.

verses.textEn: And they all went forth with their troops, a people exceedingly numerous, like the sand that is on the shore of the sea. And their horses and chariots were an immense multitude.
verses.textLa: Egressique sunt omnes cum turmis suis, populus multus nimis sicut arena, quæ est in littore maris, equi quoque et currus immensæ multitudinis.

verses.textEn: And all these kings assembled at the waters of Merom, so that they might fight against Israel.
verses.textLa: Conveneruntque omnes reges isti in unum ad Aquas Merom, ut pugnarent contra Israel.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to Joshua: “You should not fear them. For tomorrow, at this same hour, I will deliver all these to be wounded in the sight of Israel. You will hamstring their horses, and you will burn their chariots with fire.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque Dominus ad Iosue: Ne timeas eos: cras enim hac eadem hora ego tradam omnes istos vulnerandos in conspectu Israel: equos eorum subnervabis, et currus igne combures.

verses.textEn: And Joshua, and the entire army with him, came against them suddenly, at the waters of Merom, and they rushed upon them.
verses.textLa: Venitque Iosue, et omnis exercitus cum eo adversus illos ad Aquas Merom subito, et irruerunt super eos,

verses.textEn: And the Lord delivered them into the hands of Israel. And they struck them, and they pursued them as far as the great Sidon, and the waters of Misrephoth, and the field of Mizpeh, which is toward the eastern region. He struck them all, so that nothing was left of them to remain.
verses.textLa: tradiditque illos Dominus in manus Israel. Qui percusserunt eos, et persecuti sunt usque ad Sidonem magnam, et Aquas Maserephoth, campumque Masphe, qui est ad Orientalem illius partem. Ita percussit omnes, ut nullas dimitteret ex eis reliquias:

verses.textEn: And he did just as the Lord had instructed him. He hamstrung their horses, and he burned their chariots with fire.
verses.textLa: fecitque sicut præceperat ei Dominus, equos eorum subnervavit, currusque combussit igni.

verses.textEn: And turning back, he immediately seized Hazor. And he struck down its king with the sword. For Hazor, from antiquity, held the first position among all these kingdoms.
verses.textLa: Reversusque statim cepit Asor: et regem eius percussit gladio. Asor enim antiquitus inter omnia regna hæc principatum tenebat.

verses.textEn: And he struck down all the souls that were staying there. He did not leave in it any remains, but he destroyed everything unto utter annihilation, and he destroyed the city itself with fire.
verses.textLa: Percussitque omnes animas, quæ ibidem morabantur: non dimisit in ea ullas reliquias, sed usque ad internecionem universa vastavit, ipsamque urbem peremit incendio.

verses.textEn: And he seized, struck, and destroyed all the surrounding cities and their kings, just as Moses, the servant of God, had instructed him.
verses.textLa: Et omnes per circuitum civitates, regesque earum cepit, percussit atque delevit, sicut præceperat ei Moyses famulus Domini.

verses.textEn: And except for the cities that were on hills and in elevated places, the rest Israel burned. One only, highly-fortified Hazor, was consumed with fire.
verses.textLa: Absque urbibus, quæ erant in collibus, et in tumulis sitæ, ceteras succendit Israel: unam tantum Asor munitissimam flamma consumpsit.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Israel divided among themselves all the plunder of these cities, and the cattle, putting to death all persons.
verses.textLa: Omnemque prædam istarum urbium ac iumenta diviserunt sibi filii Israel, cunctis hominibus interfectis.

verses.textEn: Just as the Lord had instructed his servant Moses, so did Moses instruct Joshua, and he fulfilled everything. He did not omit even one word out of all the commandments, which the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.textLa: Sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi servo suo, ita præcepit Moyses Iosue, et ille universa complevit: non præteriit de universis mandatis, nec unum quidem verbum quod iusserat Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: And so Joshua seized the entire land of the mountains, and of the south, and the land of Goshen, and the plains, and the western region, and the mountain of Israel, and its plains.
verses.textLa: Cepit itaque Iosue omnem Terram montanam, et meridianam, terramque Gosen, et planitiem, et Occidentalem plagam, montemque Israel, et campestria eius:

verses.textEn: As for the part of the mountain that ascends to Seir, as far as Baalgad, along the plain of Lebanon under mount Hermon, all their kings he seized, struck down, and killed.
verses.textLa: et partem montis, quæ ascendit Seir usque Baalgad per planitiem Libani subter montem Hermon: omnes reges eorum cepit, percussit, et occidit.

verses.textEn: For a long time, Joshua fought against these kings.
verses.textLa: Multo tempore pugnavit Iosue contra reges istos.

verses.textEn: There was not a city that delivered itself to the sons of Israel, except the Hivites who were living at Gibeon. For he seized it all in warfare.
verses.textLa: Non fuit civitas quæ se traderet filiis Israel, præter Hevæum, qui habitabat in Gabaon: omnes enim bellando cepit.

verses.textEn: For it was the sentence of the Lord that their hearts would be hardened, and that they would fight against Israel and fall, and that they did not deserve any clemency, and that they should perish, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.textLa: Domini enim sententia fuerat, ut indurarentur corda eorum, et pugnarent contra Israel, et caderent, et non mererentur ullam clementiam, ac perirent, sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: In that time, Joshua went and put to death the Anakim from the mountains, from Hebron and Debir and Anab, and from all the mountains of Judah and Israel. And he destroyed their cities.
verses.textLa: In illo tempore venit Iosue, et interfecit Enacim de montanis, Hebron, et Dabir, et Anab, et de omni monte Iuda et Israel, urbesque eorum delevit.

verses.textEn: He did not leave any from the stock of the Anakim in the land of the sons of Israel, except the cities of Gaza, and Gath, and Ashdod, which alone were left behind.
verses.textLa: Non reliquit ullum de stirpe Enacim, in Terra filiorum Israel: absque civitatibus Gaza, et Geth, et Azoto, in quibus solis relicti sunt.

verses.textEn: Thus, Joshua seized all the land, just as the Lord spoke to Moses, and he delivered it as a possession to the sons of Israel, according to their divisions and tribes. And the land rested from battles.
verses.textLa: Cepit ergo Iosue omnem Terram, sicut locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, et tradidit eam in possessionem filiis Israel secundum partes et tribus suas. Quievitque Terra a præliis.

verses.textEn: These are the kings whom the sons of Israel struck down, and whose land they possessed beyond the Jordan, toward the rising of the sun, from the torrent Arnon as far as mount Hermon, with the entire eastern region that looks out toward the wilderness:
verses.textLa: Hi sunt reges, quos percusserunt filii Israel, et possederunt Terram eorum trans Iordanem ad solis ortum, a torrente Arnon usque ad montem Hermon, et omnem Orientalem plagam, quæ respicit solitudinem.

verses.textEn: Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon, and who had dominion from Aroer, which is situated on the bank of the torrent Arnon, and the valley in the middle, and one half of Gilead, as far as the torrent Jabbok, which is the border of the sons of Ammon,
verses.textLa: Sehon rex Amorrhæorum, qui habitavit in Hesebon, dominatus est ab Aroer, quæ sita est super ripam torrentis Arnon, et mediæ partis in valle, dimidiæque Galaad, usque ad torrentem Iaboc, qui est terminus filiorum Ammon.

verses.textEn: and from the wilderness, as far as the sea of Chinneroth toward the east, and to the Sea of the Wilderness, which is the very salty sea, to the eastern region, along the way that leads to Beth-jeshimoth, and from the southern region that lies under the descending slope of Pisgah,
verses.textLa: Et a solitudine usque ad Mare Ceneroth contra Orientem, et usque ad Mare deserti, quod est mare salsissimum, ad Orientalem plagam per viam quæ ducit Bethsimoth: et ab australi parte, quæ subiacet Asedoth, Phasga.

verses.textEn: to the border of Og, the king of Bashan; from the remnant of the Rephaim, who lived in Ashtaroth, and at Edrei, and who had dominion on mount Hermon, and at Salecah, and into all of Bashan, even to its limits;
verses.textLa: Terminus Og regis Basan, de reliquiis Raphaim, qui habitavit in Astaroth, et in Edrai, et dominatus est in monte Hermon, et in Salecha, atque in universa Basan, usque ad terminos

verses.textEn: with Geshur and Maacati, and one half of Gilead, these were the borders of Sihon, the king of Heshbon.
verses.textLa: Gessuri, et Machati, et dimidiæ partis Galaad: terminos Sehon regis Hesebon.

verses.textEn: Moses, the servant of the Lord, and the sons of Israel struck them down. And Moses delivered their land into the possession of the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the one half tribe of Manasseh.
verses.textLa: Moyses famulus Domini, et filii Israel percusserunt eos, tradiditque Terram eorum Moyses in possessionem Rubenitis, et Gaditis, et dimidiæ tribui Manasse.

verses.textEn: These are the kings of the land, whom Joshua and the sons of Israel struck down across the Jordan, toward the western region, from Baalgad in the field of Lebanon, as far as the mountain, part of which ascends to Seir. And Joshua delivered it as a possession to the tribes of Israel, to each one in their divisions,
verses.textLa: Hi sunt reges Terræ, quos percussit Iosue et filii Israel trans Iordanem ad Occidentalem plagam, a Baalgad in campo Libani, usque ad montem, cuius pars ascendit in Seir: tradiditque eam Iosue in possessionem tribubus Israel, singulis partes suas,

verses.textEn: both in the mountains and in the plains and fields. In the descending slopes, and in the wilderness, and in the south, there too was the Hittite and the Amorite, the Canaanite and the Perizzite, the Hivite and the Jebusite.
verses.textLa: tam in montanis quam in planis atque campestribus. In Asedoth, et in solitudine, ac in meridie Hethæus fuit et Amorrhæus, Chananæus et Pherezæus, Hevæus et Iebusæus.

verses.textEn: The king of Jericho, one; the king of Ai, which is beside Bethel, one;
verses.textLa: Rex Iericho unus: rex Hai, quæ est ex latere Bethel, unus:

verses.textEn: the king of Jerusalem, one; the king of Hebron, one;
verses.textLa: rex Ierusalem unus, rex Hebron unus,

verses.textEn: the king of Jarmuth, one; the king of Lachish, one;
verses.textLa: rex Ierimoth unus, rex Lachis unus,

verses.textEn: the king of Eglon, one; the king of Gezer, one;
verses.textLa: rex Eglon unus, rex Gazer unus,

verses.textEn: the king of Debir, one; the king of Geder, one;
verses.textLa: rex Dabir unus, rex Gader unus,

verses.textEn: the king of Hormah, one; the king of Arad, one;
verses.textLa: rex Herma unus, rex Hered unus,

verses.textEn: the king of Libnah, one; the king of Adullam, one;
verses.textLa: rex Lebna unus, rex Odullam unus,

verses.textEn: the king of Makkedah, one; the king of Bethel, one;
verses.textLa: rex Maceda unus, rex Bethel unus,

verses.textEn: the king of Tappuah, one; the king of Hepher, one;
verses.textLa: rex Taphua unus, rex Opher unus,

verses.textEn: the king of Aphek, one; the king of Lasharon, one;
verses.textLa: rex Aphec unus, rex Saron unus,

verses.textEn: the king of Madon, one; the king of Hazor, one;
verses.textLa: rex Madon unus, rex Asor unus,

verses.textEn: the king of Shimron, one; the king of Achshaph, one;
verses.textLa: rex Semeron unus, rex Achsaph unus,

verses.textEn: the king of Taanach, one; the king of Megiddo, one;
verses.textLa: rex Thenac unus, rex Mageddo unus,

verses.textEn: the king of Kadesh, one; the king of Jokneam of Carmel, one;
verses.textLa: rex Cades unus, rex Iachanan Carmeli unus,

verses.textEn: the king of Dor and of the province of Dor, one; the king of the nations of Gilgal, one;
verses.textLa: rex Dor, et provinciæ Dor unus, rex gentium Galgal unus,

verses.textEn: the king of Tirzah, one. All the kings were thirty-one.
verses.textLa: rex Thersa unus: omnes reges triginta unus.

verses.textEn: Joshua was old and advanced in age, and the Lord said to him: “You have grown old, and are aged, and a very wide land remains, which has not yet been divided by lot,
verses.textLa: Iosue senex, provectæque ætatis erat, et dixit Dominus ad eum: Senuisti, et longævus es, terraque latissima derelicta est, quæ necdum sorte divisa est:

verses.textEn: specifically, all of Galilee, Philistia, and all of Geshur;
verses.textLa: omnis videlicet Galilæa, Philisthiim, et universa Gessuri.

verses.textEn: from the muddy river, which irrigates Egypt, as far as the border of Ekron toward the north, the land of Canaan, which is divided among the rulers of Philistia: the Gazites, and the Ashdodites, the Ashkelonites, the Gathites, and the Ekronites;
verses.textLa: A fluvio turbido, qui irrigat Ægyptum, usque ad terminos Accaron contra Aquilonem: Terra Chanaan, quæ in quinque regulos Philisthiim dividitur, Gazæos, et Azotios, Ascalonitas, Gethæos, et Accaronitas.

verses.textEn: truly, to the south are the Hivites, all the land of Canaan, and Mearah of the Sidonians, as far as Aphek and the borders of the Amorite
verses.textLa: Ad meridiem vero sunt Hevæi, omnis Terra Chanaan, et Maara Sidoniorum usque Apheca et terminos Amorrhæi,

verses.textEn: and his confines; also, the region of Lebanon toward the east, from Baalgad, under mount Hermon, until you enter into Hamath;
verses.textLa: eiusque confinia. Libani quoque regio contra Orientem a Baalgad sub monte Hermon, donec ingrediaris Emath.

verses.textEn: all who live in the mountains from Lebanon, as far as the waters of Misrephoth, and all the Sidonians. I am the One who will wipe them out, before the face of the sons of Israel. Therefore, let their land become a part of the inheritance of Israel, just as I have instructed you.
verses.textLa: Omnium qui habitant in monte a Libano usque ad Aquas Maserephoth, universique Sidonii. Ego sum qui delebo eos a facie filiorum Israel. Veniat ergo in partem hereditatis Israel, sicut præcepi tibi.

verses.textEn: And now, divide the land as a possession to the nine tribes, and to the one half tribe of Manasseh.”
verses.textLa: Et nunc divide terram in possessionem novem tribubus, et dimidiæ tribui Manasse,

verses.textEn: With them, Reuben and Gad have possessed the land, which Moses, the servant of the Lord, delivered to them beyond the river Jordan, on the eastern side:
verses.textLa: cum qua Ruben et Gad possederunt terram, quam tradidit eis Moyses famulus Domini trans fluenta Iordanis, ad orientalem plagam.

verses.textEn: from Aroer, which is situated on the bank of the torrent Arnon and in the midst of the valley, and all the plains of Medeba, as far as Dibon;
verses.textLa: Ab Aroer, quæ sita est in ripa torrentis Arnon, et in vallis medio, universaque campestria Medaba, usque Dibon:

verses.textEn: and all the cities of Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, even to the borders of the sons of Ammon;
verses.textLa: et cunctas civitates Sehon, regis Amorrhæi, qui regnavit in Hesebon usque ad terminos filiorum Ammon:

verses.textEn: and Gilead, as well as the borders of Geshur and Maacati, and all of mount Hermon, and all of Bashan, as far as Salecah;
verses.textLa: et Galaad, ac terminum Gessuri et Machati, et omnem montem Hermon, et universam Basan, usque ad Salecha,

verses.textEn: the entire kingdom of Og in Bashan, who reigned at Ashtaroth and Edrei, (he was among the last of the Rephaim). And Moses struck and destroyed them.
verses.textLa: omne regnum Og in Basan, qui regnavit in Astaroth et Edrai, ipse fuit de reliquiis Raphaim: percussitque eos Moyses, atque delevit.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Israel were not willing to destroy Geshur and Maacati, and so they have lived in the midst of Israel, even to the present day.
verses.textLa: Nolueruntque disperdere filii Israel Gessuri et Machati: et habitaverunt in medio Israel usque in præsentem diem.

verses.textEn: But to the tribe of Levi, he did not give a possession. Instead, the sacrifices and victims of the Lord, the God of Israel, these are his inheritance, just as he spoke to him.
verses.textLa: Tribui autem Levi non dedit possessionem: sed sacrificia et victimæ Domini Dei Israel, ipsa est eius hereditas, sicut locutus est illi.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Moses gave a possession to the tribe of the sons of Reuben, according to their families.
verses.textLa: Dedit ergo Moyses possessionem tribui filiorum Ruben iuxta cognationes suas.

verses.textEn: And their border was from Aroer, which is situated on the bank of the torrent Arnon, and in the midst of the valley of the same torrent, with all the flatlands that lead to Medeba;
verses.textLa: Fuitque terminus eorum ab Aroer, quæ sita est in ripa torrentis Arnon, et in valle eiusdem torrentis media: universam planitiem, quæ ducit Medaba,

verses.textEn: and Heshbon, and all their villages, which are in the plains; also Dibon, and Bamothbaal, and the town of Baalmeon,
verses.textLa: et Hesebon, cunctosque viculos earum, qui sunt in campestribus: Dibon quoque, et Bamothbaal, et oppidum Baalmaon,

verses.textEn: and Jahaz, and Kedemoth, and Mephaath,
verses.textLa: et Iassa, et Cedimoth, et Mephaath,

verses.textEn: and Kiriathaim, and Sibmah, and Zereth-shahar on the mountain of the steep valley;
verses.textLa: et Cariathaim, et Sabama, et Sarathasar in monte convallis.

verses.textEn: Bethpeor, and the descending slopes of Pisgah, and Beth-jeshimoth;
verses.textLa: Bethphogor et Asedoth, Phasga et Bethiesimoth,

verses.textEn: and all the cities of the plain, and all the kingdoms of Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who reigned at Heshbon, whom Moses struck down with the leaders of Midian: Evi, and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur, and Reba, the commanders of Sihon, inhabitants of the land.
verses.textLa: et omnes urbes campestres, universaque regna Sehon regis Amorrhæi, qui regnavit in Hesebon, quem percussit Moyses cum principibus Madian: Hevæum, et Recem, et Sur, et Hur, et Rebe duces Sehon habitatores Terræ.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Israel killed Balaam, the son of Beor, the seer, with the sword, along with the others who were slain.
verses.textLa: Et Balaam filium Beor ariolum occiderunt filii Israel gladio cum ceteris interfectis.

verses.textEn: And the river Jordan was made the border of the sons of Reuben; this is the possession of the Reubenites, by their families, in cities and villages.
verses.textLa: Factusque est terminus filiorum Ruben Iordanis fluvius. Hæc est possessio Rubenitarum per cognationes suas urbium et viculorum.

verses.textEn: And Moses gave to the tribe of Gad and his sons, by their families, a possession, of which this is the division:
verses.textLa: Deditque Moyses tribui Gad et filiis eius per cognationes suas possessionem, cuius hæc divisio est.

verses.textEn: the border of Jazer, and all the cities of Gilead, and one half part of the land of the sons of Ammon, as far as Aroer, which is opposite Rabbah;
verses.textLa: Terminus Iaser, et omnes civitates Galaad, et dimidiam partem terræ filiorum Ammon, usque ad Aroer, quæ est contra Rabba:

verses.textEn: and from Heshbon as far as Ramath, Mizpeh, and Betonim; and from Mahanaim as far as the borders of Debir;
verses.textLa: et ab Hesebon usque Ramoth, Masphe et Betonim: et a Manaim usque ad terminos Dabir:

verses.textEn: also, in the valley Beth-haram and Beth-nimrah, and Succoth, and Zaphon, the remaining part of the kingdom of Sihon, the king of Heshbon; the limit of this also is the Jordan, as far as the furthest part of the sea of Chinnereth, beyond the Jordan on the eastern side.
verses.textLa: in valle quoque Betharan, et Bethnemra, et Socoth, et Saphon reliquam partem regni Sehon regis Hesebon: huius quoque finis, Iordanis est usque ad extremam partem maris Cenereth trans Iordanem ad orientalem plagam.

verses.textEn: This is the possession of the sons of Gad, by their families, in their cities and villages.
verses.textLa: Hæc est possessio filiorum Gad per familias suas, civitates, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: He also gave, to the one half tribe of Manasseh and to his sons, a possession according to their families,
verses.textLa: Dedit et dimidiæ tribui Manasse, filiisque eius iuxta cognationes suas possessionem,

verses.textEn: the beginning of which is this: from Mahanaim, all of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Og, the king of Bashan, and all the villages of Jair, which are in Bashan, sixty towns;
verses.textLa: cuius hoc principium est: a Manaim universam Basan, et cuncta regna Og regis Basan, omnesque vicos Iair, qui sunt in Basan, sexaginta oppida:

verses.textEn: and one half part of Gilead, and Ashtaroth, and Edrei, the cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan, to the sons of Machir, the son of Manasseh, to one half part of the sons of Machir, according to their families.
verses.textLa: et dimidiam partem Galaad, et Astaroth, et Edrai urbes regni Og in Basan: filiis Machir, filii Manasse, dimidiæ parti filiorum Machir iuxta cognationes suas.

verses.textEn: Moses divided this possession, in the plains of Moab, beyond the Jordan, opposite Jericho on the eastern side.
verses.textLa: Hanc possessionem divisit Moyses in campestribus Moab trans Iordanem contra Iericho ad Orientalem plagam.

verses.textEn: But to the tribe of Levi he did not give a possession. For the Lord, the God of Israel, is himself their possession, just as he spoke to him.
verses.textLa: Tribui autem Levi non dedit possessionem: quoniam Dominus Deus Israel ipse est possessio eius, ut locutus est illi.

verses.textEn: This is what the sons of Israel possessed in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar, the priest, and Joshua, the son of Nun, and the leaders of the families, by the tribes of Israel, gave to them,
verses.textLa: Hoc est, quod possederunt filii Israel in Terra Chanaan, quam dederunt eis Eleazar sacerdos, et Iosue filius Nun, et principes familiarum per tribus Israel:

verses.textEn: dividing all by lot, just as the Lord had instructed by the hand of Moses, to the nine tribes and to the one half tribe.
verses.textLa: sorte omnia dividentes, sicut præceperat Dominus in manu Moysi, novem tribubus, et dimidiæ tribui.

verses.textEn: For to the two and one half tribes, Moses had given a possession beyond the Jordan, aside from the Levites, who received no land among their brothers.
verses.textLa: Duabus enim tribubus, et dimidiæ dederat Moyses trans Iordanem possessionem: absque Levitis, qui nihil terræ acceperunt inter fratres suos:

verses.textEn: For by succession, the sons of Joseph, in their place, were divided into two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim. But the Levites did not receive another portion of land, except cities in which to live, and their suburbs, so as to feed their beasts of burden and cattle.
verses.textLa: sed in eorum successerunt locum filii Ioseph in duas divisi tribus, Manasse et Ephraim: nec acceperunt Levitæ aliam in Terra partem, nisi urbes ad habitandum, et suburbana earum ad alenda iumenta et pecora sua.

verses.textEn: Just as the Lord had commanded Moses, so the sons of Israel did, and they divided the land.
verses.textLa: Sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi, ita fecerunt filii Israel, et diviserunt Terram.

verses.textEn: And so, the sons of Judah approached Joshua at Gilgal. And Caleb, the son of Jephone, the Kenizzite, spoke to him: “You know what the Lord said to Moses, the man of God, at Kadesh-barnea, about me and you.
verses.textLa: Accesserunt itaque filii Iuda ad Iosue in Galgala, locutusque est ad eum Caleb filius Iephone Cenezæus: Nosti quid locutus sit Dominus ad Moysen hominem Dei de me et te in Cadesbarne.

verses.textEn: I was forty years old when Moses, the servant of the Lord, sent me from Kadesh-barnea, so that I might consider the land. And I reported to him what seemed to me to be true.
verses.textLa: Quadraginta annorum eram quando misit me Moyses famulus Domini de Cadesbarne, ut considerarem Terram, nunciavique ei quod mihi verum videbatur.

verses.textEn: But my brothers, who had ascended with me, broke the heart of the people. And I nevertheless followed the Lord my God.
verses.textLa: Fratres autem mei, qui ascenderant mecum, dissolverunt cor populi: et nihilominus ego secutus sum Dominum Deum meum.

verses.textEn: And Moses swore, on that day, saying: ‘The land that your foot has tread upon shall be your possession, and that of your sons, unto eternity. For you have followed the Lord my God.’
verses.textLa: Iuravitque Moyses in die illo, dicens: Terra, quam calcavit pes tuus, erit possessio tua, et filiorum tuorum in æternum: quia secutus es Dominum Deum meum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the Lord has granted life to me, just as he promised, even to the present day. It has been forty-five years since the Lord spoke this word to Moses, when Israel was wandering through the wilderness. Today, I am eighty-five years old,
verses.textLa: Concessit ergo Dominus vitam mihi, sicut pollicitus est usque in præsentem diem. Quadraginta et quinque anni sunt, ex quo locutus est Dominus verbum istud ad Moysen, quando ambulabat Israel per solitudinem: hodie octoginta quinque annorum sum,

verses.textEn: being just as strong as I was at that time, when I was sent to explore the land. The fortitude in me at that time continues even until today, as much to fight as to march.
verses.textLa: sic valens, ut eo valebam tempore quando ad explorandum missus sum: illius in me temporis fortitudo usque hodie perseverat, tam ad bellandum quam ad gradiendum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, grant to me this mountain, which the Lord has promised in your hearing also, on which are the Anakim, and cities, great and fortified. Perhaps it may be that the Lord will be with me, and I will be able to destroy them, just as he promised to me.”
verses.textLa: Da ergo mihi montem istum, quem pollicitus est Dominus, te quoque audiente, in quo Enacim sunt, et urbes magnæ atque munitæ: si forte sit Dominus mecum, et potuero delere eos: sicut promisit mihi.

verses.textEn: And Joshua blessed him, and he delivered Hebron to him as a possession.
verses.textLa: Benedixitque ei Iosue: et tradidit ei Hebron in possessionem.

verses.textEn: And from then on, Hebron was for Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, the Kenizzite, even to the present day. For he followed the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.textLa: Atque ex eo fuit Hebron Caleb filio Iephone Cenezæo usque in præsentem diem: quia secutus est Dominum Deum Israel.

verses.textEn: Previously, the name Hebron was called Kiriath-Arba. Adam, the greatest among the Anakim, was laid there. And the land ceased from battles.
verses.textLa: Nomen Hebron ante vocabatur Cariath Arbe: Adam maximus ibi inter Enacim situs est: et Terra cessavit a præliis.

verses.textEn: And so, the lot of the sons of Judah, by their families, was this: from the border of Edom, to the desert of Sin toward the south, and even to the furthest part of the southern region.
verses.textLa: Igitur sors filiorum Iudæ per cognationes suas ista fuit: A termino Edom, desertum Sin contra Meridiem, et usque ad extremam partem australis plagæ.

verses.textEn: Its beginning was from the summit of the very salty sea, and from its bay, which looks toward the south.
verses.textLa: Initium eius a summitate maris salsissimi, et a lingua eius, quæ respicit Meridiem.

verses.textEn: And it extends toward the ascent of the Scorpion, and it passes on to Sinai. And it ascends into Kadesh-barnea, and it passes through to Hezron, ascending to Addar, and encompassing Karka.
verses.textLa: Egrediturque contra Ascensum Scorpionis, et pertransit in Sina: ascenditque in Cadesbarne, et pervenit in Esron, ascendens ad Addar, et circuiens Carcaa,

verses.textEn: And from there, it passes on to Azmon, and reaches to the torrent of Egypt. And its boundary shall be the great sea; this shall be the limit of the southern region.
verses.textLa: atque inde pertransiens in Asemona, et perveniens ad Torrentem Ægypti: eruntque termini eius mare magnum. Hic erit finis meridianæ plagæ.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, toward the east, the beginning shall be the very salty sea, even to the limit of the Jordan, and that which looks toward the north, from the bay of the sea, even to the same river Jordan.
verses.textLa: Ab Oriente vero erit initium, mare salsissimum usque ad extrema Iordanis: et ea quæ respiciunt ad Aquilonem a lingua maris usque ad eundem Iordanis fluvium.

verses.textEn: And the border ascends into Beth-hoglah, and it crosses from the north into Beth-Arabah, ascending to the stone of Bohan, the son of Reuben.
verses.textLa: Ascenditque terminus in Beth-hagla, et transit ab Aquilone in Beth Araba: ascendens ad lapidem Boen filii Ruben.

verses.textEn: And it reaches as far as the borders of Debara, from the Valley of Achor, to the north, looking toward Gilgal, which is opposite the Ascent of Adummim, on the southern part of the torrent. And it crosses the waters that are called the Fountain of the Sun. And its exit shall be at the Fountain of Rogel.
verses.textLa: Et tendens usque ad terminos Debera de Valle Achor, contra Aquilonem respiciens Galgala, quæ est ex adverso Ascensionis Adommim, ab australi parte torrentis: transitque aquas, quæ vocantur Fons Solis: et erunt exitus eius ad Fontem Rogel.

verses.textEn: And it ascends by the steep valley of the son of Hinnom, from the side of the Jebusite, toward the south; this is Jerusalem. And from there, it raises itself to the top of the mountain, which is opposite Geennom to the west, at the top of the Valley of the Rephaim, to the north.
verses.textLa: Ascenditque per convallem filii Ennom ex latere Iebusæi ad Meridiem, hæc est Ierusalem: et inde se erigens ad verticem montis, qui est contra Geennom ad Occidentem in summitate Vallis Raphaim contra Aquilonem.

verses.textEn: And it passes through, from the top of the mountain, even to the fountain of the Water of Nephtoah. And it continues on, as far as the villages of mount Ephron. And it inclines toward Baalah, which is Kiriath-jearim, that is, the City of Forests.
verses.textLa: Pertransitque a vertice montis usque ad fontem aquæ Nephtoa: et pervenit usque ad vicos montis Ephron: inclinaturque in Baala, quæ est Cariathiarim, id est, urbs silvarum.

verses.textEn: And it circles from Baalah, to the west, as far as mount Seir. And it passes by the side of mount Jearim, to the north, into Chesalon. And it descends into Beth-shemesh, and it passes through to Timnah.
verses.textLa: Et circuit de Baala contra Occidentem, usque ad montem Seir: transitque iuxta latus montis Iarim ad Aquilonem in Cheslon: et descendit in Bethsames, transitque in Thamna.

verses.textEn: And it continues on, toward the north, to a region beside Ekron. And it inclines toward Shikkeron, and it crosses to mount Baalah. And it extends into Jabneel, and the last part closes at the west with the great sea.
verses.textLa: Et pervenit contra Aquilonem partis Accaron ex latere: inclinaturque Sechrona, et transit montem Baala: pervenitque in Iebneel, et magni maris contra Occidentem fine concluditur.

verses.textEn: These are the borders of the sons of Judah, in their families, on all sides.
verses.textLa: Hi sunt termini filiorum Iuda per circuitum in cognationibus suis.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, to Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, he gave a portion in the midst of the sons of Judah, just as the Lord had instructed him: the City of Arba, the father of Anak, which is Hebron.
verses.textLa: Caleb vero filio Iephone dedit partem in medio filiorum Iuda, sicut præceperat ei Dominus: Cariath Arbe patris Enac, ipsa est Hebron.

verses.textEn: And Caleb destroyed from it the three sons of Anak, Sheshai, and Ahiman, and Talmai, of the stock of Anak.
verses.textLa: Delevitque ex ea Caleb tres filios Enac, Sesai et Ahiman et Tholmai de stirpe Enac.

verses.textEn: And ascending further from there, he came to the inhabitants of Debir, which before was called Kiriath-Sepher, that is, the City of Letters.
verses.textLa: Atque inde conscendens venit ad habitatores Dabir, quæ prius vocabatur Cariath Sepher, id est, civitas litterarum.

verses.textEn: And Caleb said, “Whoever will have struck down Kiriath-Sepher, and will have seized it, I will give to him Achsah, my daughter, as wife.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque Caleb: Qui percusserit Cariath Sepher, et ceperit eam, dabo ei Axam filiam meam uxorem.

verses.textEn: And Othniel, the son of Kenaz, the younger brother of Caleb, seized it. And he gave him Achsah, his daughter, as wife.
verses.textLa: Cepitque eam Othoniel filius Cenez frater Caleb iunior: deditque ei Axam filiam suam uxorem.

verses.textEn: And as they were traveling together, she was urged by her husband that she ask her father for a field. And she sighed, as she was sitting on her donkey. And Caleb said to her, “What is it?”
verses.textLa: Quæ, cum pergerent simul, suasa est a viro suo ut peteret a patre suo agrum, suspiravitque ut sedebat in asino. Cui Caleb: Quid habes, inquit?
verses.notes: Literally, the question is ‘What do you have?’

verses.textEn: But she answered: “Give a blessing to me. You have given to me a southern and dry land; join to it also a watered land.” And so Caleb gave to her the watered land above and below it.
verses.textLa: At illa respondit: Da mihi benedictionem: Terram australem et arentem dedisti mihi, iunge et irriguam. Dedit itaque ei Caleb irriguum superius et inferius.

verses.textEn: This is the possession of the tribe of the sons of Judah, by their families.
verses.textLa: Hæc est possessio tribus filiorum Iuda per cognationes suas.

verses.textEn: And the cities, from the furthest parts of the sons of Judah, beside the borders of Edom to the south, were: Kabzeel and Eder and Jagur,
verses.textLa: Erantque civitates ab extremis partibus filiorum Iuda iuxta terminos Edom a Meridie: Cabseel et Eder et Iagur,

verses.textEn: and Kinah and Dimonah and Adadah,
verses.textLa: et Cyna et Dimona et Adada,

verses.textEn: and Kadesh and Hazor and Ithnan,
verses.textLa: et Cades, et Asor, et Iethnam,

verses.textEn: Ziph and Telem and Bealoth,
verses.textLa: Ziph et Telem et Baloth,

verses.textEn: new Hazor and Kerioth-Hezron, which is Hazor,
verses.textLa: Asor nova et Carioth Hesron, hæc est Asor,

verses.textEn: Amam, Shema, and Moladah,
verses.textLa: Amam, Sama, et Molada,

verses.textEn: and Hazar-gaddah and Heshmon and Bethpelet,
verses.textLa: et Asergadda et Hassemon et Bethphelet,

verses.textEn: and Hazar-shual and Beersheba and Biziothiah,
verses.textLa: et Hasersual et Bersabee et Baziothia,

verses.textEn: and Baalah and Iim and Ezem,
verses.textLa: et Baala et Iim et Esem,

verses.textEn: and Eltolad and Chesil and Hormah,
verses.textLa: et Eltholad et Cesil et Harma,

verses.textEn: and Ziklag and Madmannah and Sansannah,
verses.textLa: et Siceleg et Medemena et Sensenna,

verses.textEn: Lebaoth and Shilhim, and Ain and Rimmon. All the cities were twenty-nine, and their villages.
verses.textLa: Lebaoth et Selim et Aen et Remon. Omnes civitates vigintinovem, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: Truly, in the plains, there were: Eshtaol and Zorah and Ashnah,
verses.textLa: In campestribus vero: Estaol et Sarea et Asena,

verses.textEn: and Zanoah and Engannim, and Tappuah and Enam,
verses.textLa: et Zanoe et Ængannim et Taphua et Enaim,

verses.textEn: and Jarmuth and Adullam, Socoh and Azekah,
verses.textLa: et Ierimoth et Adullam, Socho et Azeca,

verses.textEn: and Shaaraim and Adithaim, and Gederah and Gederothaim: fourteen cities, and their villages.
verses.textLa: et Saraim et Adithaim et Gedera et Gederothaim: urbes quattuordecim, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: Zenan and Hadashah and Middalgad,
verses.textLa: Sanan et Hadassa et Magdalgad,

verses.textEn: Dilean and Mizpeh and Joktheel,
verses.textLa: Delean et Masepha et Iecthel,

verses.textEn: Lachish and Bozkath and Eglon,
verses.textLa: Lachis et Bascath et Eglon,

verses.textEn: Cabbon and Lahmam and Chitlish,
verses.textLa: Chebbon et Leheman et Cethlis,

verses.textEn: and Gederoth and Bethdagon, and Naamah and Makkedah: sixteen cities, and their villages.
verses.textLa: et Gideroth et Bethdagon et Naama et Maceda: civitates sedecim, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: Libnah and Ether and Ashan,
verses.textLa: Labana et Ether et Asan,

verses.textEn: Iphtah and Ashnah and Nezib,
verses.textLa: Iephtha et Esna et Nesib,

verses.textEn: and Keilah and Achzib and Mareshah: nine cities, and their villages.
verses.textLa: et Ceila et Achzib et Maresa: civitates novem, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: Ekron, with its towns and villages:
verses.textLa: Accaron cum vicis et villulis suis.

verses.textEn: from Ekron, as far as the sea, all that inclines toward Ashdod, and its villages.
verses.textLa: Ab Accaron usque ad mare: omnia quæ vergunt ad Azotum et viculos eius.

verses.textEn: Ashdod, with its towns and villages. Gaza, with its towns and villages, as far as the torrent of Egypt, with the great sea as its border.
verses.textLa: Azotus cum vicis et villulis suis. Gaza cum vicis et villulis suis, usque ad torrentem Ægypti, et mare magnum terminus eius.

verses.textEn: And on the mountain, Shamir and Jattir and Socoh,
verses.textLa: Et in monte: Samir et Iether et Socoth,

verses.textEn: and Dannah, and Kiriath-Sannah, which is Debir,
verses.textLa: et Danna et Cariathsenna, hæc est Dabir:

verses.textEn: Anab and Eshtemoh and Anim,
verses.textLa: Anab et Istemo et Anim,

verses.textEn: Goshen and Holon and Giloh: eleven cities, and their villages.
verses.textLa: Gosen et Olon et Gilo: civitates undecim et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: Arab and Dumah and Eshan,
verses.textLa: Arab et Ruma et Esaan,

verses.textEn: and Janim and Beth-Tappuah and Aphekah,
verses.textLa: et Ianum et Beththaphua et Apheca,

verses.textEn: Humtah and Kiriath-Arba, which is Hebron, and Zior: nine cities, and their villages.
verses.textLa: Athmatha et Cariath Arbe, hæc est Hebron, et Sior: civitates novem, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: Maon and Carmel, and Ziph and Juttah,
verses.textLa: Maon et Carmel et Ziph et Iota,

verses.textEn: Jezreel and Jokdeam and Zanoah,
verses.textLa: Iezrael et Iucadam et Zanoe,

verses.textEn: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah: ten cities, and their villages.
verses.textLa: Accain, Gabaa et Thamna: civitates decem, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: Halhul and Bethzur and Gedor,
verses.textLa: Halhul, et Besur, et Gedor,

verses.textEn: Maarath and Bethanoth and Eltekon: six cities, and their villages.
verses.textLa: Mareth, et Bethanoth, et Eltecon: civitates sex et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: Kiriath-baal, which is Kiriath-jearim, the City of Forests, and Rabbah: two cities, and their villages.
verses.textLa: Cariathbaal, hæc est Cariathiarim urbs silvarum, et Arebba: civitates duæ, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: In the desert: Beth-Arabah, Middin, and Secacah,
verses.textLa: In deserto Betharaba, Meddin, et Sachacha,

verses.textEn: and Nibshan, and the City of Salt, and Engedi: six cities, and their villages.
verses.textLa: et Nebsan, et civitas salis, et Engaddi: civitates sex, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: But the sons of Judah were not able to destroy the Jebusite inhabitants of Jerusalem. And so the Jebusite lived with the sons of Judah in Jerusalem, even to the present day.
verses.textLa: Iebusæum autem habitatorem Ierusalem non potuerunt filii Iuda delere: habitavitque Iebusæus cum filiis Iuda in Ierusalem usque in præsentem diem.

verses.textEn: Similarly, the lot of the sons of Joseph fell from the Jordan, opposite Jericho and its waters, to the east, to the wilderness that ascends from Jericho to the mountain of Bethel.
verses.textLa: Cecidit quoque sors filiorum Ioseph ab Iordane contra Iericho et aquas eius ab Oriente: solitudo quæ ascendit de Iericho ad montem Bethel:

verses.textEn: And it goes out from Bethel to Luz. And it crosses the border of Archi to Ataroth.
verses.textLa: et egreditur de Bethel Luza: transitque terminum Archi, Ataroth.

verses.textEn: And it descends to the west, beside the border of Japhleti, as far as the borders of lower Beth-horon, and to Gezer. And the last parts of its regions are by the great sea.
verses.textLa: Et descendit ad Occidentem iuxta terminum Iephleti, usque ad terminos Beth horon inferioris, et Gazer: finiunturque regiones eius mari magno:

verses.textEn: And Manasseh and Ephraim, the sons of Joseph, possessed it.
verses.textLa: possederuntque filii Ioseph, Manasses et Ephraim.

verses.textEn: And the border of the sons of Ephraim was made by their families. And their possession toward the east was from Ataroth-addar, as far as upper Beth-horon,
verses.textLa: Et factus est terminus filiorum Ephraim per cognationes suas: et possessio eorum contra Orientem Ataroth addar usque Beth horon superiorem.

verses.textEn: and the confines extend to the sea. Yet truly, Michmethath looks toward the north, and it circles around the borders, toward the east, into Taanath-shiloh. And it continues on, from the east, to Janoah.
verses.textLa: Egrediunturque confinia in mare: Machmethath vero Aquilonem respicit, et circuit terminos contra Orientem in Thanathselo: et pertransit ab Oriente Ianoe.

verses.textEn: And it descends from Janoah to Ataroth and Naarah. and it continues to Jericho, and it extends to the Jordan.
verses.textLa: Descenditque de Ianoe in Ataroth et Naaratha: et pervenit in Iericho, egrediturque ad Iordanem.

verses.textEn: From Tappuah, it passes on, opposite the sea, into the Valley of Reeds. And its exit is at the very salty sea. This is the possession of the tribe of the sons of Ephraim, by their families.
verses.textLa: De Taphua pertransit contra mare in Vallem Arundineti, suntque egressus eius in mare salsissimum. Hæc est possessio tribus filiorum Ephraim per familias suas.

verses.textEn: And there were cities, with their villages, which were set aside for the sons of Ephraim, in the midst of the possession of the sons of Manasseh.
verses.textLa: Urbesque separatæ sunt filiis Ephraim in medio possessionis filiorum Manasse, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Ephraim did not put to death the Canaanite that was living at Gezer. And the Canaanite lived in the midst of Ephraim, even to this day, paying tribute.
verses.textLa: Et non interfecerunt filii Ephraim Chananæum, qui habitabat in Gazer: habitavitque Chananæus in medio Ephraim usque in diem hanc tributarius.

verses.textEn: Now this lot fell to the tribe of Manasseh, since he is the firstborn of Joseph: to Machir, the firstborn of Manasseh, the father of Gilead, who was a fighting man, and he had as a possession Gilead and Bashan;
verses.textLa: Cecidit autem sors tribui Manasse: (ipse enim est primogenitus Ioseph) Machir primogenito Manasse patri Galaad, qui fuit vir pugnator, habuitque possessionem Galaad et Basan:

verses.textEn: and to the rest of the sons of Manasseh, according to their families: to the sons of Abiezer, and to the sons of Helek, and to the sons of Asriel, and to the sons of Shechem, and to the sons of Hepher, and to the sons of Shemida. These are the sons of Manasseh, the son of Joseph, the males, by their families.
verses.textLa: et reliquis filiorum Manasse iuxta familias suas, filiis Abiezer, et filiis Helec, et filiis Esriel, et filiis Sechem, et filiis Hepher, et filiis Semida. Isti sunt filii Manasse filii Ioseph, mares, per cognationes suas.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, had no sons, but only daughters, whose names are these: Mahlah and Noah and Hoglah and Milcah and Tirzah.
verses.textLa: Salphaad vero filio Hepher filii Galaad filii Machir filii Manasse non erant filii, sed solæ filiæ: quarum ista sunt nomina, Maala et Noa et Hegla et Melcha et Thersa.

verses.textEn: And they went before the sight of Eleazar, the priest, and Joshua, the son of Nun, and the leaders, saying: “The Lord instructed by the hand of Moses that a possession ought to be given to us, in the midst of our brothers.” And so, he gave to them, in accord with the order of the Lord, a possession in the midst of the brothers of their father.
verses.textLa: Veneruntque in conspectu Eleazari sacerdotis, et Iosue filii Nun, et principum dicentes: Dominus præcepit per manum Moysi, ut daretur nobis possessio in medio fratrum nostrorum. Deditque eis iuxta imperium Domini possessionem in medio fratrum patris earum.

verses.textEn: And by lot, there fell ten portions to Manasseh, aside from the land of Gilead and Bashan beyond the Jordan.
verses.textLa: Et ceciderunt funiculi Manasse, decem, absque Terra Galaad et Basan trans Iordanem.

verses.textEn: And so the daughters of Manasseh possessed an inheritance in the midst of his sons. But the land of Gilead fell by lot to the sons of Manasseh that were left.
verses.textLa: Filiæ enim Manasse possederunt hereditatem in medio filiorum eius. Terra autem Galaad cecidit in sortem filiorum Manasse qui reliqui erant.

verses.textEn: And the border of Manasseh was from Asher to Michmethath, which looks out toward Shechem. And it goes out, to the right, beside the inhabitants of the Fountain of Tappuah.
verses.textLa: Fuitque terminus Manasse ab Aser, Machmethath quæ respicit Sichem: et egreditur ad dexteram iuxta habitatores Fontis Taphuæ.

verses.textEn: For by lot, there also fell to Manasseh the land of Tappuah, which is beside the borders of Manasseh, and which belongs to the sons of Ephraim.
verses.textLa: Etenim in sorte Manasse ceciderat Terra Taphuæ, quæ est iuxta terminos Manasse filiorum Ephraim.

verses.textEn: And the border descends to the Valley of Reeds, to the south of the torrent of the cities of Ephraim, which are in the midst of the cities of Manasseh. The border of Manasseh is to the north of the torrent, and its exit extends to the sea.
verses.textLa: Descenditque terminus Vallis Arundineti in meridiem torrentis civitatum Ephraim, quæ in medio sunt urbium Manasse: terminus Manasse ab Aquilone torrentis, et exitus eius pergit ad mare:

verses.textEn: So it is that the possession of Ephraim is in the south, and that of Manasseh is in the north, and both are enclosed by the sea, and they are joined together by the tribe of Asher to the north, and by the tribe of Issachar to the east.
verses.textLa: ita ut possessio Ephraim sit ab Austro, et ab Aquilone Manasse, et utramque claudat mare, et coniungantur sibi in tribu Aser ab Aquilone, et in tribu Issachar ab Oriente.

verses.textEn: And the inheritance of Manasseh, in Issachar and in Asher, was Bethshean and its villages, and Ibleam with its villages, and the inhabitants of Dor, with their towns, likewise the inhabitants of Endor with their villages, and similarly the inhabitants of Taanach with their villages, and the inhabitants of Megiddo with their villages, and one third part of the city of Naphath.
verses.textLa: Fuitque hereditas Manasse in Issachar et in Aser, Bethsan et viculi eius, et Ieblaam cum viculis suis, et habitatores Dor cum oppidis suis, habitatores quoque Endor cum viculis suis: similiterque habitatores Thenac cum viculis suis, et habitatores Mageddo cum viculis suis, et tertia pars urbis Nopheth.

verses.textEn: The sons of Manasseh were not able to overthrow these cities, and so the Canaanite began to dwell in their land.
verses.textLa: Nec potuerunt filii Manasse has civitates subvertere, sed cœpit Chananæus habitare in terra sua.

verses.textEn: But after the sons of Israel had grown strong, they subdued the Canaanites, and made them their tributaries, but they did not kill them.
verses.textLa: Postquam autem convaluerunt filii Israel, subiecerunt Chananæos, et fecerunt sibi tributarios, nec interfecerunt eos.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Joseph spoke to Joshua, and they said, “Why have you given to me as a possession one lot and one portion, while I am of such a great multitude, and the Lord has blessed me?”
verses.textLa: Locutique sunt filii Ioseph ad Iosue, et dixerunt: Quare dedisti mihi possessionem sortis et funiculi unius, cum sim tantæ multitudinis, et benedixerit mihi Dominus?

verses.textEn: And Joshua said to them, “If you are a numerous people, go up into the forest, and cut out space for yourself in the land of the Perizzites and the Rephaim, since the possession of mount Ephraim is too narrow for you.”
verses.textLa: Ad quos Iosue ait: Si populus multus es, ascende in silvam, et succide tibi spatia in Terra Pherezæi et Raphaim: quia angusta est tibi possessio montis Ephraim.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Joseph responded to him: “We are not able to ascend to the mountains, since the Canaanites, who live in the plains, in which are situated Bethshean, with its villages, and Jezreel, possessing the middle of the valley, use chariots of iron.”
verses.textLa: Cui responderunt filii Ioseph: Non poterimus ad montana conscendere, cum ferreis curribus utantur Chananæi, qui habitant in terra campestri, in qua sitæ sunt Bethsan cum viculis suis, et Iezrael mediam possidens vallem.

verses.textEn: And Joshua said to the house of Joseph, to Ephraim and Manasseh: “You are a numerous people, and you have great strength. You shall not have only one lot.
verses.textLa: Dixitque Iosue ad domum Ioseph, Ephraim et Manasse: Populus multus es, et magnæ fortitudinis, non habebis sortem unam,

verses.textEn: Instead, you shall cross to the mountain, and you shall cut down and clear out for yourselves space in which to live. And you shall be able to advance further, when you will have destroyed the Canaanite, who, as you say, has iron chariots and is very strong.”
verses.textLa: sed transibis ad montem, et succides tibi, atque purgabis ad habitandum spatia: et poteris ultra procedere cum subverteris Chananæum, quem dicis ferreos habere currus, et esse fortissimum.

verses.textEn: And all the sons of Israel gathered together at Shiloh, and there they stationed the Tabernacle of the Testimony. And the land was subjected to them.
verses.textLa: Congregatique sunt omnes filii Israel in Silo, ibique fixerunt tabernaculum testimonii, et fuit eis Terra subiecta.

verses.textEn: But there remained seven tribes of the sons of Israel which had not yet received their possessions.
verses.textLa: Remanserant autem filiorum Israel septem tribus, quæ necdum acceperant possessiones suas.

verses.textEn: And Joshua said to them: “For how long will you draw back in idleness, and not enter to possess the land, which the Lord, the God of your fathers, has given to you?
verses.textLa: Ad quos Iosue ait: Usquequo marcetis ignavia, et non intratis ad possidendam Terram, quam Dominus Deus patrum vestrorum dedit vobis?

verses.textEn: Select three men from each tribe, so that I may send them, and they may go forth and circle through the land, and may describe it according to the number of each multitude, and may bring back to me what they have written down.
verses.textLa: Eligite de singulis tribubus ternos viros, ut mittam eos, et pergant atque circumeant Terram, et describant eam iuxta numerum uniuscuiusque multitudinis: referantque ad me quod descripserint.

verses.textEn: Divide the land for yourselves into seven parts. Let Judah be its bounds on the southern side, and the house of Joseph to the north.
verses.textLa: Dividite vobis Terram in septem partes: Iudas sit in terminis suis ab australi plaga, et domus Ioseph ab Aquilone.

verses.textEn: The land that is in the middle, between these, write it down in seven parts. And you shall come to me, so that I may cast lots for you about this, before the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Mediam inter hos Terram in septem partes describite: et huc venietis ad me, ut coram Domino Deo vestro mittam vobis hic sortem:

verses.textEn: But there is no portion among you for the Levites. Instead, the priesthood of the Lord is their inheritance. And Gad and Reuben, and the one half tribe of Manasseh, have already received their possessions beyond the Jordan in the eastern region, which Moses, the servant of the Lord, gave to them.”
verses.textLa: quia non est inter vos pars Levitarum, sed sacerdotium Domini est eorum hereditas. Gad autem et Ruben, et dimidia tribus Manasse iam acceperant possessiones suas trans Iordanem ad Orientalem plagam: quas dedit eis Moyses famulus Domini.

verses.textEn: And when the men had risen up, so that they might go out to describe the land, Joshua instructed them, saying, “Circle through the land, and describe it, and return to me, so that I may cast lots for you about this, before the Lord, in Shiloh.”
verses.textLa: Cumque surrexissent viri, ut pergerent ad describendam terram, præcepit eis Iosue, dicens: Circuite Terram, et describite eam, ac revertimini ad me: ut hic coram Domino, in Silo, mittam vobis sortem.

verses.textEn: And so they went out. And surveying it, they divided it into seven parts, writing it in a book. And they returned to Joshua, to the camp at Shiloh.
verses.textLa: Itaque perrexerunt: et lustrantes eam, in septem partes diviserunt, scribentes in volumine. Reversique sunt ad Iosue in castra Silo.

verses.textEn: And he cast lots before the Lord, at Shiloh, and he divided the land to the sons of Israel, in seven parts.
verses.textLa: Qui misit sortes coram Domino in Silo, divisitque Terram filiis Israel in septem partes.

verses.textEn: And the first lot went to the sons of Benjamin, by their families, so that they would possess the land between the sons of Judah and the sons of Joseph.
verses.textLa: Et ascendit sors prima filiorum Beniamin per familias suas, ut possiderent Terram inter filios Iuda et filios Ioseph.

verses.textEn: And their border toward the north was from the Jordan, continuing on, near the side of Jericho in the northern region, and from there, ascending toward the west to the mountains, and extending to the wilderness of Bethaven.
verses.textLa: Fuitque terminus eorum contra Aquilonem a Iordane: pergens iuxta latus Iericho septentrionalis plagæ, et inde contra Occidentem ad montana conscendens, et perveniens ad solitudinem Bethaven,

verses.textEn: And it continues to the south beside Luz, which is Bethel. And it descends into Ataroth-addar, at the mountain which is to the south of lower Beth-horon.
verses.textLa: atque pertransiens iuxta Luzam ad Meridiem, ipsa est Bethel: descenditque in Ataroth addar in montem, qui est ad Meridiem Beth horon inferioris:

verses.textEn: And it turns aside, circling toward the sea, to the south of the mountain which looks out toward Beth-horon, toward the southwest. And its exits are toward Kiriath-baal, which is also called Kiriath-jearim, a city of the sons of Judah. This is their region, toward the sea, in the west.
verses.textLa: Et inclinatur circuiens contra mare ad Meridiem montis qui respicit Beth horon contra Africum: suntque exitus eius in Cariath baal, quæ vocatur et Cariathiarim, urbem filiorum Iuda. Hæc est plaga contra mare, ad Occidentem.

verses.textEn: But to the south, the border goes on from the part of Kiriath-jearim toward the sea, and it continues as far as the Fountain of the waters of Nephtoah.
verses.textLa: A Meridie autem ex parte Cariathiarim egreditur terminus contra mare, et pervenit usque ad fontem aquarum Nephtoa.

verses.textEn: And it descends to that part of the mountain which looks out toward the Valley of the sons of Hinnom. And it is opposite the northern region, in the furthest part of the Valley of the Rephaim. And it descends into Geennom, (that is, the Valley of Hinnom,) near the side of the Jebusite toward the south. And it extends to the Fountain of Rogel,
verses.textLa: Descenditque in partem montis, qui respicit Vallem filiorum Ennom: et est contra septentrionalem plagam in extrema parte Vallis Raphaim. Descenditque in Geennom (id est, Vallem Ennom) iuxta latus Iebusæi ad Austrum: et pervenit ad Fontem Rogel,

verses.textEn: crossing from there to the north, and going out to En-Shemesh, that is, to the Fountain of the Sun.
verses.textLa: transiens ad Aquilonem, et egrediens ad Ensemes, id est, Fontem Solis:

verses.textEn: And it passes through to the hills that are opposite the region of the Ascent of Adummim. And it descends to Abenboen, that is, so the stone of Bohan, the son of Reuben. And it continues on, at the northern side, to the plains. And it descends into the flatlands.
verses.textLa: et pertransit usque ad tumulos, qui sunt e regione Ascensus Adommim: descenditque ad Abenboen, id est, lapidem Boen filii Ruben: et pertransit ex latere Aquilonis ad campestria: descenditque in planitiem,

verses.textEn: And it advances before Beth-hoglah, to the north. And its exits are to the north, opposite the bay of the very salty sea, in the southern region at the end of the Jordan,
verses.textLa: et prætergreditur contra Aquilonem Beth hagla: suntque exitus eius contra linguam maris salsissimi ab Aquilone in fine Iordanis ad australem plagam:

verses.textEn: which is its border to the east. This is the possession of the sons of Benjamin, with their borders all around, and by their families.
verses.textLa: qui est terminus illius ab Oriente. Hæc est possessio filiorum Beniamin per terminos suos in circuitu, et familias suas.

verses.textEn: And their cities were: Jericho and Beth-hoglah and the Abrupt Valley,
verses.textLa: Fueruntque civitates eius, Iericho et Beth hagla et Vallis Casis,

verses.textEn: Beth-arabah and Zemaraim and Bethel,
verses.textLa: Beth Araba et Samaraim et Bethel,

verses.textEn: and Avvim and Parah and Ophrah,
verses.textLa: et Avim et Aphara et Ophera,

verses.textEn: the town of Ammoni, and Ophni, and Geba: twelve cities, and their villages;
verses.textLa: villa Emona et Ophni et Gabee: civitates duodecim, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: Gibeon and Ramah and Beeroth,
verses.textLa: Gabaon et Rama et Beroth,

verses.textEn: and Mizpeh and Chephirah and Mozah,
verses.textLa: et Mesphe et Caphara et Amosa,

verses.textEn: and Rekem, Irpeel, and Taralah,
verses.textLa: et Recem, Iarephel, et Tharela,

verses.textEn: and Zela, Haeleph, and Jebus, which is Jerusalem, Gibeah and Kiriath: fourteen cities, and their villages. This is the possession of the sons of Benjamin, according to their families.
verses.textLa: et Sela, Eleph, et Iebus, quæ est Ierusalem, Gabaath et Cariath: civitates quattuordecim, et villæ earum. Hæc est possessio filiorum Beniamin iuxta familias suas.

verses.textEn: And the second lot went out, for the sons of Simeon by their families. And their inheritance was,
verses.textLa: Et egressa est sors secunda filiorum Simeon per cognationes suas: fuitque hereditas eorum

verses.textEn: in the midst of the possession of the sons of Judah: Beersheba, and Sheba, and Moladah,
verses.textLa: in medio possessionis filiorum Iuda: Bersabee et Sabee et Molada,

verses.textEn: and Hazar-shual, Balah, and Ezem,
verses.textLa: et Hasersual, Bala et Asem,

verses.textEn: and Eltolad, Bethul, and Hormah,
verses.textLa: et Eltholad, Bethul et Harma,

verses.textEn: and Ziklag, and Beth-marcaboth, and Hazar-susah,
verses.textLa: et Siceleg et Bethmarchaboth et Hasersusa,

verses.textEn: and Bethlebaoth, and Sharuhen: thirteen cities, and their villages;
verses.textLa: et Bethlebaoth et Sarohen: civitates tredecim, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: Ain and Enrimmon, and Ether and Ashan: four cities, and their villages;
verses.textLa: Ain et Remmon et Athar et Asan: civitates quattuor, et villæ earum:

verses.textEn: all villages around these cities, as far as Baalath-beer, the high place facing the southern region. This is the inheritance of the sons of Simeon, according to their families,
verses.textLa: omnes viculi per circuitum urbium istarum usque ad Baalath Beer Ramath contra australem plagam. Hæc est hereditas filiorum Simeon iuxta cognationes suas,
verses.notes: Ramath means the high place or the heights.

verses.textEn: within the possession and lot of the sons of Judah, which was greater. And for this reason, the sons of Simeon had a possession in the midst of their inheritance.
verses.textLa: in possessione et funiculo filiorum Iuda: quia maior erat, et idcirco filii Simeon possederunt in medio hereditatis eorum.

verses.textEn: And the third lot fell to the sons of Zebulun, by their families; and the limit of their possession was set as far as Sarid.
verses.textLa: Ceciditque sors tertia filiorum Zabulon per cognationes suas: factus est terminus possessionis eorum usque Sarid.

verses.textEn: And it ascends from the sea and from Mareal. And it passes on to Dabbesheth, as far as the torrent, which is opposite Jokneam.
verses.textLa: Ascenditque de mari et Merala, et pervenit in Debbaseth, usque ad torrentem qui est contra Ieconam.

verses.textEn: And it turns back from Sarid, to the east, to the end of Chisloth-tabor. And it goes out to Daberath, and it ascends opposite Japhia.
verses.textLa: Et revertitur de Sared contra Orientem in fines Ceseleththabor: et egreditur ad Dabereth, ascenditque contra Iaphie.

verses.textEn: And from there, it continues to the eastern region of Gathhepher and Ethkazin. And goes out to Rimmon, Amthar, and Neah.
verses.textLa: Et inde pertransit usque ad orientalem plagam Gethhepher et Thacasin: et egreditur in Remmon, Amthar et Noa.

verses.textEn: And it circles to the north at Hannathon. And its exits are at the Valley of Iphtahel;
verses.textLa: Et circuit ad Aquilonem Hanathon: suntque egressus eius Vallis Iephthael,

verses.textEn: and Kattath and Nahalal, and Shimron and Idalah, and Bethlehem: twelve cities, and their villages.
verses.textLa: et Cateth et Naalol et Semeron et Ierala et Bethlehem: civitates duodecim, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the sons of Zebulun, by their families, the cities and their villages.
verses.textLa: Hæc est hereditas tribus filiorum Zabulon per cognationes suas, urbes et viculi earum.

verses.textEn: The fourth lot went out to Issachar, by their families.
verses.textLa: Issachar egressa est sors quarta per cognationes suas.

verses.textEn: And his inheritance was: Jezreel, and Chesulloth, and Shunem,
verses.textLa: Fuitque eius hereditas Iezrael et Casaloth et Sunem

verses.textEn: and Hapharaim, and Shion, and Anaharath,
verses.textLa: et Hapharaim et Seon, et Anaharath

verses.textEn: and Rabbith and Kishion, Ebez
verses.textLa: et Rabboth et Cesion, Abes,

verses.textEn: and Remeth, and Engannim, and Enhaddah, and Bethpazzez.
verses.textLa: et Rameth, et Engannim, et Enhadda et Bethpheses.

verses.textEn: And its limit reaches to Tabor and Shahazumah and Beth-shemesh; and its exits shall be at the Jordan: sixteen cities, and their villages.
verses.textLa: Et pervenit terminus eius usque Thabor et Sehesima et Bethsames: eruntque exitus eius Iordanis: civitates sedecim, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: This is the possession of the sons of Issachar by their families, the cities and their villages.
verses.textLa: Hæc est possessio filiorum Issachar per cognationes suas, urbes, et viculi earum.

verses.textEn: And the fifth lot fell to the tribe of the sons of Asher, by their families.
verses.textLa: Ceciditque sors quinta tribui filiorum Aser per cognationes suas:

verses.textEn: And their border was: Helkath, and Hali, and Beten, and Achshaph,
verses.textLa: fuitque terminus eorum Halcath et Chali et Beten et Axaph

verses.textEn: and Allammelech, and Amad, and Mishal. And it extends even to Carmel by the sea, and Shihor, and Libnath.
verses.textLa: et Elmelech et Amaad et Messal: et pervenit usque ad Carmelum maris et Sihor et Labanath.

verses.textEn: And it turns back toward the east at Bethdagon. And it continues on as far as Zebulun and the Valley of Iphtahel, toward the north, at Beth-emek and Neiel. And it goes out to the left of Cabul,
verses.textLa: Ac revertitur contra orientem Bethdagon: et pertransit usque Zabulon et Vallem Iephthael contra Aquilonem in Bethemec et Nehiel. Egrediturque ad lævam Cabul,

verses.textEn: and to Ebron, and Rehob, and Hammon, and Kanah, as far as the great Sidon.
verses.textLa: et Abran et Rohob et Hamon et Cana, usque ad Sidonem magnam.

verses.textEn: And it turns back at Ramah, even to the very fortified city of Tyre, and even to Hosah. And its exits shall be at the sea, from the lot of Achzib;
verses.textLa: Revertiturque in Horma usque ad civitatem munitissimam Tyrum, et usque Hosa: eruntque exitus eius in mare de funiculo Achziba:

verses.textEn: and Ummah, and Aphek, and Rehob: twenty-two cities, and their villages.
verses.textLa: et Amma et Aphec et Rohob: civitates viginti duæ, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: This is the possession of the sons of Asher, by their families, and the cities and their villages.
verses.textLa: Hæc est possessio filiorum Aser per cognationes suas, urbesque et viculi earum.

verses.textEn: The sixth lot fell to the sons of Naphtali, by their families.
verses.textLa: Filiorum Nephthali sexta sors cecidit per familias suas:

verses.textEn: And its border begins from Heleph and Elon, into Zaanannim, and Adami, which is Nekeb, and Jabneel, as far as Lakkum. And its exits are as far as the Jordan.
verses.textLa: et cœpit terminus de Heleph et Elon in Saananim, et Adami, quæ est Neceb, et Iebnael usque Lecum: et egressus eorum usque ad Iordanem:

verses.textEn: And the border turns back to the west at Aznoth-tabor, and it goes out from there to Hukkok. And continues on to Zebulun, in the south, and to Asher, in the west, and to Judah, at the Jordan, toward the rising of the sun.
verses.textLa: revertiturque terminus contra Occidentem in Azanotthabor, atque inde egreditur in Hucuca, et pertransit in Zabulon contra Meridiem, et in Aser contra Occidentem, et in Iuda ad Iordanem contra ortum solis.

verses.textEn: And the most fortified cities are Ziddim, Zer and Hammath, and Rakkath, and Chinnereth,
verses.textLa: Civitates munitissimæ, Assedim, Ser, et Emath, et Reccath et Cenereth,

verses.textEn: and Adamah and Ramah, Hazor
verses.textLa: et Edema et Arama, Asor

verses.textEn: and Kedesh and Edrei, Enhazor
verses.textLa: et Cedes et Edrai, Enhasor

verses.textEn: and Yiron and Migdalel, Horem and Bethanath, and Beth-shemesh: nineteen cities, and their villages.
verses.textLa: et Ieron et Magdalel, Horem et Bethanath et Bethsames: civitates decem et novem, et villæ earum.

verses.textEn: This is the possession of the tribe of the sons of Naphtali, by their families, the cities and their villages.
verses.textLa: Hæc est possessio tribus filiorum Nephthali per cognationes suas, urbes et viculi earum.

verses.textEn: The seventh lot went out to the tribe of the sons of Dan, by their families.
verses.textLa: Tribui filiorum Dan per familias suas egressa est sors septima:

verses.textEn: And the border of their possession was Zorah, and Eshtaol, and Ir-shemesh, that is, the City of the Sun,
verses.textLa: et fuit terminus possessionis eius Sara et Esthaol, et Hirsemes, id est, civitas solis.

verses.textEn: Sha-alabbin, and Aijalon, and Ithlah,
verses.textLa: Selebin et Aialon et Iethela,

verses.textEn: Elon, and Timnah, and Ekron,
verses.textLa: Elon et Themna et Acron,

verses.textEn: Eltekeh, Gibbethon and Baalath,
verses.textLa: Elthece, Gebbethon et Balaath,
