verses.textEn: and Jehud, and Bene and Berak, and Gath-Rimmon,
verses.textLa: et Iud et Bane et Barach et Gethremmon:

verses.textEn: and Mejarkon and Rakkon, with a border that looks toward Joppa,
verses.textLa: et Meiarcon et Arecon, cum termino qui respicit Ioppen,

verses.textEn: and there the last part is concluded. And the sons of Dan ascended and fought against Leshem, and they seized it. And they struck it with the mouth of the sword, and they possessed it, and they lived in it, calling it by the name of Leshem-Dan, according to the name of their father Dan.
verses.textLa: et ipso fine concluditur. Ascenderuntque filii Dan, et pugnaverunt contra Lesem, ceperuntque eam: et percusserunt eam in ore gladii, et possederunt, et habitaverunt in ea, vocantes nomen eius Lesem Dan, ex nomine Dan patris sui.

verses.textEn: This is the possession of the tribe of the sons of Dan, by their families, the cities and their villages.
verses.textLa: Hæc est possessio tribus filiorum Dan, per cognationes suas, urbes et viculi earum.

verses.textEn: And when he had completed dividing the land by lot to each one by their tribes, the sons of Israel gave a possession to Joshua, the son of Nun, in their midst,
verses.textLa: Cumque complesset sorte dividere Terram singulis per tribus suas, dederunt filii Israel possessionem Iosue filio Nun in medio sui,

verses.textEn: in accord with the precept of the Lord, the city he requested, Timnath-Serah, on mount Ephraim. And he built up the city, and he lived in it.
verses.textLa: iuxta præceptum Domini, urbem quam postulavit, Thamnath Saraa in monte Ephraim: et ædificavit civitatem, habitavitque in ea.

verses.textEn: These are the possessions which Eleazar, the priest, and Joshua, the son of Nun, and the leaders of the families and tribes of the sons of Israel divided by lot at Shiloh, before the Lord, at the door of the Tabernacle of the Testimony. And so did they divide the land.
verses.textLa: Hæ sunt possessiones, quas sorte diviserunt Eleazar sacerdos, et Iosue filius Nun, et principes familiarum, ac tribuum filiorum Israel in Silo, coram Domino ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii, partitique sunt Terram.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Joshua, saying: “Speak to the sons of Israel, and say to them:
verses.textLa: Et locutus est Dominus ad Iosue, dicens: Loquere filiis Israel, et dic eis:

verses.textEn: Separate the cities of refuge, about which I spoke to you by the hand of Moses,
verses.textLa: Separate urbes fugitivorum, de quibus locutus sum ad vos per manum Moysi;

verses.textEn: so that anyone who will have struck down a life unintentionally may flee to them. And so, he may be able to escape from the wrath of a close relative, who is an avenger of blood.
verses.textLa: ut confugiat ad eas quicumque animam percusserit nescius: et possit evadere iram proximi, qui ultor est sanguinis:

verses.textEn: And when he will have fled to one of these cities, he shall stand before the gate of the city, and he shall speak to the ancients of that city, the things that prove him innocent. And so shall they receive him, and give him a place in which to live.
verses.textLa: cum ad unam harum confugerit civitatum, stabit ante portam civitatis, et loquetur senioribus urbis illius ea, quæ se comprobent innocentem: sicque suscipient eum, et dabunt ei locum ad habitandum.

verses.textEn: And if the avenger of blood will have pursued him, they shall not deliver him into his hands. For he struck down his neighbor unknowingly, one who was not proven to have been his enemy two or three days before.
verses.textLa: Cumque ultor sanguinis eum fuerit persecutus, non tradent in manus eius: quia ignorans percussit proximum eius, nec ante biduum, triduumve eius probatur inimicus.

verses.textEn: And he shall live in that city, until he stands before judgment in order to render the facts of his case, and until the death of the high priest, whoever it will be in that time. Then the one who killed a man may return, and he may enter his own city and house, from which he had fled.”
verses.textLa: Et habitabit in civitate illa, donec stet ante iudicium causam reddens facti sui, et moriatur sacerdos magnus, qui fuerit in illo tempore: tunc revertetur homicida, et ingredietur civitatem et domum suam de qua fugerat.

verses.textEn: And they decreed Kedesh in Galilee, at mount Naphtali, and Shechem, at mount Ephraim, and Kiriath-Arba, which is Hebron, at mount Judah.
verses.textLa: Decreveruntque Cedes in Galilæa montis Nephthali, et Sichem in monte Ephraim, et Cariatharbe, ipsa est Hebron in monte Iuda.

verses.textEn: And beyond the Jordan, opposite the eastern side of Jericho, they appointed Bezer, which is situated on the plain of the wilderness of the tribe of Reuben, and Ramoth in Gilead of the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan of the tribe of Manasseh.
verses.textLa: Et trans Iordanem contra Orientalem plagam Iericho, statuerunt Bosor, quæ sita est in campestri solitudine de tribu Ruben, et Ramoth in Galaad de tribu Gad, et Gaulon in Basan de tribu Manasse.

verses.textEn: These cities were established for all the sons of Israel, and for the new arrivals who were living among them, so that whoever had struck down a life unintentionally might flee to these, and not die at the hand of a close relative who desires to vindicate the blood that was shed, until he should stand before the people, in order to present his case.
verses.textLa: Hæ civitates constitutæ sunt cunctis filiis Israel, et advenis, qui habitabant inter eos: ut fugeret ad eas qui animam nescius percussisset, et non moreretur in manu proximi, effusum sanguinem vindicare cupientis, donec staret ante populum expositurus causam suam.

verses.textEn: And the leaders of the families of Levi approached Eleazar, the priest, and Joshua, the son of Nun, and the rulers of the extended families of each of the tribes of the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Accesseruntque principes familiarum Levi ad Eleazarum sacerdotem, et Iosue filium Nun, et ad duces cognationum per singulas tribus filiorum Israel:
verses.notes: Israel was ordered by family relations, with smaller and larger groups according to how closely they were related, which might be rendered something like: family, extended family, tribe, Israel.

verses.textEn: And they spoke to them at Shiloh, in the land of Canaan, and they said, “The Lord instructed, by the hand of Moses, that cities should be given to us as habitations, with their suburbs to nourish our cattle.”
verses.textLa: locutique sunt ad eos in Silo Terræ Chanaan, atque dixerunt: Dominus præcepit per manum Moysi, ut darentur nobis urbes ad habitandum, et suburbana earum ad alenda iumenta.

verses.textEn: And so the sons of Israel gave cities and their suburbs from their possessions, in accord with the order of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Dederuntque filii Israel de possessionibus suis iuxta imperium Domini, civitates et suburbana earum.

verses.textEn: And the lot went out for the family of Kohath, of the sons of Aaron, the priest, from the tribes of Judah and Simeon and Benjamin: thirteen cities.
verses.textLa: Egressaque est sors in familiam Caath filiorum Aaron sacerdotis de tribubus Iuda, et Simeon, et Beniamin, civitates tredecim:

verses.textEn: And to the remainder of the sons of Kohath, that is, to the Levites who were left over, there went, from the tribes of Ephraim and Dan, and from the one half tribe of Manasseh, ten cities.
verses.textLa: Et reliquis filiorum Caath, id est, Levitis, qui superfuerant de tribubus Ephraim, et Dan, et dimidia tribu Manasse, civitates decem.

verses.textEn: And next the lot went out to the sons of Gershon, so that they would receive, from the tribes of Issachar and Asher and Naphtali, and from the one half tribe of Manasseh at Bashan: the number of thirteen cities.
verses.textLa: Porro filii Gerson egressa est sors, ut acciperent de tribubus Issachar et Aser et Nephthali, dimidiaque tribu Manasse in Basan civitates numero tredecim.

verses.textEn: And to the sons of Merari, by their families, from the tribes of Reuben and Gad and Zebulun, there went twelve cities.
verses.textLa: Et filiis Merari per cognationes suas de tribubus Ruben et Gad et Zabulon urbes duodecim.

verses.textEn: And so the sons of Israel gave cities and their suburbs to the Levites, just as the Lord instructed by the hand of Moses, distributing to each by lot.
verses.textLa: Dederuntque filii Israel Levitis civitates et suburbana earum, sicut præcepit Dominus per manum Moysi, singulis sorte tribuentes.

verses.textEn: From the tribes of the sons of Judah and Simeon, Joshua gave cities, whose names are these:
verses.textLa: De tribubus filiorum Iuda et Simeon dedit Iosue civitates: quarum ista sunt nomina,

verses.textEn: to the sons of Aaron, of the families of Kohath of the stock of Levi, (for the first lot went out for them,)
verses.textLa: filiis Aaron per familias Caath Levitici generis (prima enim sors illis egressa est)

verses.textEn: the city of Arba, the father of Anak, which is called Hebron, on the mountain of Judah, and its surrounding suburbs.
verses.textLa: Cariatharbe patris Enac, quæ vocatur Hebron, in monte Iuda, et suburbana eius per circuitum.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the fields and its villages he had given to Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, as a possession.
verses.textLa: Agros vero, et villas eius dederat Caleb filio Iephone ad possidendum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, he gave to the sons of Aaron the priest, Hebron as a city of refuge, as well as its suburbs, and Libnah, with its suburbs,
verses.textLa: Dedit ergo filiis Aaron sacerdotis Hebron confugii civitatem, ac suburbana eius: et Lobnam cum suburbanis suis:

verses.textEn: and Jattir, and Eshtemoa,
verses.textLa: et Iether, et Esthemo,

verses.textEn: and Holon, and Debir,
verses.textLa: et Holon, et Dabir,

verses.textEn: and Ain, and Juttah, and Beth-shemesh, with their suburbs: nine cities from two tribes, just as has been said.
verses.textLa: et Ain, et Ieta, et Bethsames, cum suburbanis suis: civitates novem de tribubus, ut dictum est, duabus.

verses.textEn: Then, from the tribe of the sons of Benjamin, he gave Gibeon, and Geba,
verses.textLa: De tribu autem filiorum Beniamin, Gabaon, et Gabæ,

verses.textEn: and Anathoth, and Almon, with their suburbs: four cities.
verses.textLa: et Anathoth et Almon, cum suburbanis suis: civitates quattuor.

verses.textEn: All the cities together of the sons of Aaron, the priest, were thirteen, with their suburbs.
verses.textLa: Omnes simul civitates filiorum Aaron sacerdotis, tredecim, cum suburbanis suis.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the remainder of the families of the sons of Kohath, of the stock of Levi, were given this possession:
verses.textLa: Reliquis vero per familias filiorum Caath Levitici generis hæc est data possessio.

verses.textEn: from the tribe of Ephraim, Shechem, one of the cities of refuge, with its suburbs, on mount Ephraim, and Gezer,
verses.textLa: De tribu Ephraim urbes confugii, Sichem cum suburbanis suis in monte Ephraim, et Gazer

verses.textEn: and Kibzaim, and Beth-horon, with their suburbs, four cities;
verses.textLa: et Cibsaim et Beth horon, cum suburbanis suis, civitates quattuor.

verses.textEn: and from the tribe of Dan, Elteke and Gibbethon,
verses.textLa: De tribu quoque Dan, Eltheco et Gabathon,

verses.textEn: and Aijalon and Gath-Rimmon, with their suburbs, four cities;
verses.textLa: et Aialon et Gethremmon, cum suburbanis suis, civitates quattuor.

verses.textEn: then, from the one half tribe of Manasseh, Taanach and Gath-Rimmon, with their suburbs, two cities.
verses.textLa: Porro de dimidia tribu Manasse, Thanach et Gethremmon, cum suburbanis suis civitates duæ.

verses.textEn: All the cities were ten, with their suburbs; these were given to the sons of Kohath, of the lesser degree.
verses.textLa: Omnes civitates decem, et suburbana earum, datæ sunt filiis Caath inferioris gradus.

verses.textEn: Likewise, to the sons of Gershon, of the stock of Levi, from the one half tribe of Manasseh, went Golan in Bashan, one of the cities of refuge, and Bosra, with their suburbs, two cities;
verses.textLa: Filiis quoque Gerson Levitici generis dedit de dimidia tribu Manasse confugii civitates, Gaulon in Basan, et Bosram, cum suburbanis suis, civitates duas.

verses.textEn: also, from the tribe of Issachar, Kishion, and Daberath,
verses.textLa: Porro de tribu Issachar, Cesion, et Dabereth,

verses.textEn: and Jarmuth, and Engannim, with their suburbs, four cities;
verses.textLa: et Iaramoth, et Engannim, cum suburbanis suis, civitates quattuor.

verses.textEn: then, from the tribe of Asher, Mishal and Abdon,
verses.textLa: De tribu autem Aser, Masal et Abdon,

verses.textEn: and Helkath and Rehob, with their suburbs, four cities;
verses.textLa: et Helcath, et Rohob, cum suburbanis suis, civitates quattuor.

verses.textEn: likewise, from the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee, one of the cities of refuge, and Hammoth-Dor, and Kartan, with their suburbs, three cities.
verses.textLa: De tribu quoque Nephthali civitates confugii, Cedes in Galilæa, et Hammoth Dor, et Carthan, cum suburbanis suis, civitates tres.

verses.textEn: All the cities of the families of Gershon were thirteen, with their suburbs.
verses.textLa: Omnes urbes familiarum Gerson, tredecim, cum suburbanis suis.

verses.textEn: Then, to the sons of Merari, Levites of the lesser degree, by their families, were given, from the tribe of Zebulun, Jokneam and Kartah,
verses.textLa: Filiis autem Merari Levitis inferioris gradus per familias suas data est de tribu Zabulon, Iecnam et Cartha

verses.textEn: and Dimnah and Nahalal, four cities with their suburbs;
verses.textLa: et Damna et Naalol, civitates quattuor cum suburbanis suis.

verses.textEn: from the tribe of Reuben, beyond the Jordan, opposite Jericho, Bezer in the wilderness, one of the cities of refuge, Misor and Jazer, and Jethson and Mephaath, four cities with their suburbs;
verses.textLa: De tribu Ruben ultra Iordanem contra Iericho civitates refugii, Bosor in solitudine, Misor et Iaser et Iethson et Mephaath, civitates quattuor cum suburbanis suis.

verses.textEn: from the tribe of Gad, Ramoth of Gilead, one of the cities of refuge, and Mahanaim and Heshbon and Jazer, four cities with their suburbs.
verses.textLa: De tribu Gad civitates confugii, Ramoth in Galaad, et Manaim et Hesebon et Iazer, civitates quattuor cum suburbanis suis.

verses.textEn: All the cities of the sons of Merari, by their families and extended families, were twelve.
verses.textLa: Omnes urbes filiorum Merari per familias et cognationes suas, duodecim.

verses.textEn: And so all the cities of the Levites, in the midst of the possession of the sons of Israel, were forty-eight,
verses.textLa: Itaque civitates universæ Levitarum in medio possessionis filiorum Israel fuerunt quadragintaocto

verses.textEn: with their suburbs, each distributed by families.
verses.textLa: cum suburbanis suis, singulæ per familias distributæ.

verses.textEn: And the Lord God gave to Israel all the land that he had sworn he would deliver to their fathers. And they possessed it, and they lived in it.
verses.textLa: Deditque Dominus Deus Israeli omnem Terram, quam traditurum se patribus eorum iuraverat: et possederunt illam, atque habitaverunt in ea.

verses.textEn: And he gave them peace with all the surrounding nations. And none of their enemies dared to stand against them; instead, they were brought under their sovereignty.
verses.textLa: Dataque est ab eo pax in omnes per circuitum nationes: nullusque eis hostium resistere ausus est, sed cuncti in eorum ditionem redacti sunt.

verses.textEn: Indeed, not so much as one word that he had promised to provide for them was left empty; instead, everything was fulfilled.
verses.textLa: Ne unum quidem verbum, quod illis præstiturum se esse promiserat, irritum fuit, sed rebus expleta sunt omnia.

verses.textEn: In the same time, Joshua called the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the one half tribe of Manasseh.
verses.textLa: Eodem tempore vocavit Iosue Rubenitas, et Gaditas, et dimidiam tribum Manasse,

verses.textEn: And he said to them: “You have done all that Moses, the servant of the Lord, instructed you. You have also obeyed me in all things.
verses.textLa: dixitque ad eos: Fecistis omnia quæ præcepit vobis Moyses famulus Domini: mihi quoque in omnibus obedistis,

verses.textEn: Neither have you forsaken your brothers during this long time, even to the present day, keeping the orders of the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: nec reliquistis fratres vestros longo tempore, usque in præsentem diem, custodientes imperium Domini Dei vestri.

verses.textEn: Therefore, since the Lord your God has given your brothers peace and quiet, just as he promised: return, and go into your tents and into the land of your possession, which Moses, the servant of the Lord, delivered to you beyond the Jordan.
verses.textLa: Quia igitur dedit Dominus Deus vester fratribus vestris quietem et pacem, sicut pollicitus est: revertimini, et ite in tabernacula vestra, et in terram possessionis, quam tradidit vobis Moyses famulus Domini trans Iordanem:

verses.textEn: And may you continue to observe attentively, and to work to fulfill, the commandment and the law that Moses, the servant of the Lord, instructed to you, so that you may love the Lord your God, and walk in all his ways, and keep all his commandments, and cling to him, and serve him with all your heart and with all your soul.”
verses.textLa: ita dumtaxat, ut custodiatis attente, et opere compleatis mandatum et legem quam præcepit vobis Moyses famulus Domini, ut diligatis Dominum Deum vestrum, et ambuletis in omnibus viis eius, et observetis mandata illius, adhæreatisque ei, ac serviatis in omni corde, et in omni anima vestra.

verses.textEn: And Joshua blessed them, and he sent them away. And they returned to their tents.
verses.textLa: Benedixitque eis Iosue, et dimisit eos. Qui reversi sunt in tabernacula sua.

verses.textEn: Now to the one half tribe of Manasseh, Moses had given a possession in Bashan. And therefore, to the one half that was left over, Joshua gave a lot among the remainder of their brothers across the Jordan, in the western region. And when he had blessed them and dismissed them to their tents,
verses.textLa: Dimidiæ autem tribui Manasse possessionem Moyses dederat in Basan: et idcirco mediæ, quæ superfuit, dedit Iosue sortem inter ceteros fratres suos trans Iordanem ad Occidentalem plagam. Cumque dimitteret eos in tabernacula sua, et benedixisset eis,

verses.textEn: he said to them: “Return to your settlements with much substance and wealth, with silver and gold, brass and iron, and a multitude of garments. Divide the spoils of your enemies with your brothers.”
verses.textLa: dixit ad eos: In multa substantia atque divitiis revertimini ad sedes vestras, cum argento et auro, ære ac ferro, et veste multiplici: dividite prædam hostium cum fratribus vestris.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Reuben, and the sons of Gad, and the one half tribe of Manasseh returned, and they went away from the sons of Israel at Shiloh, which is situated in Canaan, so that they might enter into Gilead, the land of their possession, which they had obtained according to the order of the Lord, by the hand of Moses.
verses.textLa: Reversique sunt, et abierunt filii Ruben, et filii Gad, et dimidia tribus Manasse, a filiis Israel de Silo, quæ sita est in Chanaan, ut intrarent Galaad Terram possessionis suæ, quam obtinuerant iuxta imperium Domini in manu Moysi.

verses.textEn: And when they had arrived at the hills of the Jordan in the land of Canaan, they built an altar of immense magnitude beside the Jordan.
verses.textLa: Cumque venissent ad tumulos Iordanis in Terram Chanaan, ædificaverunt iuxta Iordanem altare infinitæ magnitudinis.

verses.textEn: And when the sons of Israel had heard of it, and certain messengers had reported to them that the sons of Reuben, and of Gad, and of the one half tribe of Manasseh had built an altar in the land of Canaan, upon the hills of the Jordan, facing the sons of Israel,
verses.textLa: Quod cum audissent filii Israel, et ad eos certi nuncii detulissent ædificasse filios Ruben, et Gad, et dimidiæ tribus Manasse, altare in Terra Chanaan, super Iordanis tumulos, contra filios Israel:

verses.textEn: they all assembled at Shiloh, so that they might go up and battle against them.
verses.textLa: convenerunt omnes in Silo, ut ascenderent, et dimicarent contra eos.

verses.textEn: And in the interim, they sent to them, in the land of Gilead, Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the priest,
verses.textLa: Et interim miserunt ad illos in Terram Galaad Phinees filium Eleazari sacerdotis,

verses.textEn: and ten leaders with him, one from each tribe.
verses.textLa: et decem principes cum eo, singulos de singulis tribubus.

verses.textEn: And they went to the sons of Reuben, and of Gad, and of the one half tribe of Manasseh, in the land of Gilead, and they said to them:
verses.textLa: Qui venerunt ad filios Ruben, et Gad, et dimidiæ tribus Manasse in Terram Galaad, dixeruntque ad eos:

verses.textEn: “All the people of the Lord declare this: What is this transgression? Why have you forsaken the Lord, the God of Israel, by building a sacrilegious altar, and by withdrawing from the worship of him?
verses.textLa: Hæc mandat omnis populus Domini: Quæ est ista transgressio? Cur reliquistis Dominum Deum Israel, ædificantes altare sacrilegum, et a cultu illius recedentes?

verses.textEn: Is it a small thing to you that you have sinned with Baal of Peor, and that the stain of that crime continues among us, even to the present day? And many of the people have fallen.
verses.textLa: An parum vobis est quod peccastis in Beelphegor, et usque in præsentem diem macula huius sceleris in nobis permanet? Multique de populo corruerunt.

verses.textEn: And yet you have forsaken the Lord today, and tomorrow his wrath will rage against all of Israel.
verses.textLa: Et vos hodie reliquistis Dominum, et cras in universum Israel ira eius desæviet.

verses.textEn: But if you consider the land of your possession to be unclean, cross over to the land in which is the tabernacle of the Lord, and live among us. But do not withdraw from the Lord, and from our fellowship, by building an altar contrary to the altar of the Lord our God.
verses.textLa: Quod si putatis immundam esse terram possessionis vestræ, transite ad Terram, in qua tabernaculum Domini est, et habitate inter nos: tantum ut a Domino, et a nostro consortio non recedatis, ædificato altari præter altare Domini Dei nostri.

verses.textEn: Did not Achan, the son of Zerah, go against the commandment of the Lord, and so his wrath was laid over all the people of Israel? And he was only one man. If only he had perished in his wickedness alone!”
verses.textLa: Nonne Achan filius Zare præteriit mandatum Domini, et super omnem populum Israel ira eius incubuit? Et ille erat unus homo, atque utinam solum periisset in scelere suo.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Reuben, and of Gad, and of the one half tribe of Manasseh responded to the leaders of the delegation from Israel:
verses.textLa: Responderuntque filii Ruben et Gad, et dimidia tribus Manasse principibus legationis Israel:

verses.textEn: “The Lord, the almighty God, the Lord, the almighty God, he knows, and also Israel will understand: If we have constructed this altar with intent of transgression, let him not preserve us, but instead punish us immediately.
verses.textLa: Fortissimus Deus Dominus, Fortissimus Deus Dominus, ipse novit, et Israel simul intelliget: si prævaricationis animo, hoc altare construximus, non custodiat nos, sed puniat nos in præsenti:

verses.textEn: And if we have acted with a mind so that we might present upon it holocausts, and sacrifice, and victims of peace offerings, let him inquire and judge.
verses.textLa: et si ea mente fecimus ut holocausta, et sacrificium, et pacificas victimas super eo imponeremus, ipse quærat et iudicet:

verses.textEn: Instead, we have acted with this greater thought and design, that we would say: Tomorrow your sons will say to our sons: ‘What is there between you and the Lord, the God of Israel?
verses.textLa: et non ea magis cogitatione atque tractatu, ut diceremus: Cras dicent filii vestri filiis nostris: Quid vobis et Domino Deo Israel?

verses.textEn: The Lord has stationed the river Jordan as the border between us and you, O sons of Reuben, O sons of Gad. And therefore, you have no part in the Lord.’ And by this occasion, your sons would turn away our sons from the fear of the Lord. And so we sought something better,
verses.textLa: Terminum posuit Dominus inter nos et vos, o filii Ruben, et filii Gad, Iordanem fluvium: et idcirco partem non habetis in Domino. Et per hanc occasionem avertent filii vestri filios nostros a timore Domini. Putavimus itaque melius,

verses.textEn: and we said: Let us build us an altar, not for holocausts, and not to offer victims,
verses.textLa: et diximus: Extruamus nobis altare, non in holocausta, neque ad victimas offerendas,

verses.textEn: but as a testimony between us and you, and between our descendants and your progeny, so that we may serve the Lord, and so that it may be our right to offer holocausts, and victims, and peace offerings, and so that tomorrow your sons may not say to our sons: ‘You have no part in the Lord.’
verses.textLa: sed in testimonium inter nos et vos, et sobolem nostram vestramque progeniem, ut serviamus Domino, et iuris nostri sit offerre et holocausta, et victimas, et pacificas hostias: et nequaquam dicant cras filii vestri filiis nostris: Non est vobis pars in Domino.

verses.textEn: And if they decide to say this, they shall respond to them: ‘Behold, the altar of the Lord, which our fathers made, not for holocausts, and not for sacrifice, but instead as a testimony between us and you.’
verses.textLa: Quod si voluerint dicere, respondebunt eis: Ecce altare Domini, quod fecerunt patres nostri, non in holocausta, neque in sacrificium, sed in testimonium nostrum ac vestrum.

verses.textEn: May this wickedness be far from us, such that we would withdraw from the Lord, and would forsake his paths, by constructing an altar to offer holocausts, and sacrifices, and victims, contrary to the altar of the Lord our God, which was built before his tabernacle.”
verses.textLa: Absit a nobis hoc scelus ut recedamus a Domino, et eius vestigia relinquamus, extructo altari ad holocausta, et sacrificia, et victimas offerendas, præter altare Domini Dei nostri, quod extructum est ante tabernaculum eius.

verses.textEn: And when Phinehas, the priest, and the leaders of the delegation who were with him, had heard this, they were pleased. And they accepted very willingly the words of the sons of Reuben, and of Gad, and of the one half tribe of Manasseh.
verses.textLa: Quibus auditis, Phinees sacerdos, et principes legationis Israel, qui erant cum eo, placati sunt: et verba filiorum Ruben, et Gad, et dimidiæ tribus Manasse, libentissime susceperunt.

verses.textEn: And Phinehas, the priest, the son of Eleazar, said to them: “Now we know that the Lord is with us. For you are a stranger to this transgression. And so you have freed the sons of Israel from the hand of the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Dixtque Phinees filius Eleazari sacerdos ad eos: Nunc scimus quod nobiscum sit Dominus, quoniam alieni estis a prævaricatione hac, et liberastis filios Israel de manu Domini.

verses.textEn: And he returned with the leaders, from the sons of Reuben and of Gad, out of the land of Gilead, into the parts of Canaan, to the sons of Israel. And he reported to them.
verses.textLa: Reversusque est cum principibus a filiis Ruben et Gad de Terra Galaad, finium Chanaan ad filios Israel, et retulit eis.

verses.textEn: And the word pleased all who heard it. And the sons of Israel praised God, and they no longer said that they would go up against them, and fight, and destroy the land of their possession.
verses.textLa: Placuitque sermo cunctis audientibus. Et laudaverunt Deum filii Israel, et nequaquam ultra dixerunt, ut ascenderent contra eos, atque pugnarent, et delerent Terram possessionis eorum.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad called the altar that they had built: Our testimony that the Lord himself is God.
verses.textLa: Vocaveruntque filii Ruben, et filii Gad altare, quod extruxerant, Testimonium nostrum, quod Dominus ipse sit Deus.

verses.textEn: Now a long time passed, after the Lord had given peace to Israel by subjecting all the surrounding nations. And Joshua was now old and very advanced in age.
verses.textLa: Evoluto autem multo tempore, postquam pacem dederat Dominus Israeli, subiectis in gyro nationibus universis, et Iosue iam longævo, et persenilis ætatis:

verses.textEn: Joshua called all of Israel, and those greater by birth, and the leaders and rulers and teachers, and he said to them: “I am elderly and advanced in age.
verses.textLa: vocavit Iosue omnem Israelem, maioresque natu, et principes ac duces, et magistros, dixitque ad eos: Ego senui, et progressioris ætatis sum:

verses.textEn: And you yourselves discern all that the Lord your God has done with all the surrounding nations, in what manner he himself has fought for you.
verses.textLa: vosque cernitis omnia, quæ fecerit Dominus Deus vester cunctis per circuitum nationibus, quo modo pro vobis ipse pugnaverit:

verses.textEn: And now, since he has divided to you by lot all the land, from the eastern part of the Jordan even to the great sea, and yet many nations still remain,
verses.textLa: et nunc quia vobis sorte divisit omnem Terram, ab Orientali parte Iordanis usque ad mare magnum, multæque adhuc supersunt nationes:

verses.textEn: the Lord your God will destroy them, and he will take them away before your face, and you shall possess the land, just as he has promised you.
verses.textLa: Dominus Deus vester disperdet eas et auferet a facie vestra, et possidebitis Terram, sicut vobis pollicitus est.

verses.textEn: Even so, be strengthened and be careful that you observe all the things that have been written in the book of the law of Moses, and that you do not turn aside from them, neither to the right, nor to the left.
verses.textLa: Tantum confortamini, et estote soliciti, ut custodiatis cuncta quæ scripta sunt in volumine legis Moysi: et non declinetis ab eis neque ad dexteram neque ad sinistram:

verses.textEn: Otherwise, after you have entered to the Gentiles, who will be among you in the future, you might swear by the name of their gods, and serve them, and adore them.
verses.textLa: ne postquam intraveritis ad Gentes, quæ inter vos futuræ sunt, iuretis in nomine deorum earum, et serviatis eis, et adoretis illos:

verses.textEn: Instead, cling to the Lord your God, just as you have done even to this day.
verses.textLa: sed adhæreatis Domino Deo vestro: quod fecistis usque in diem hanc.

verses.textEn: And then the Lord God will take away, in your sight, nations that are great and very robust, and no one will be able to withstand you.
verses.textLa: Et tunc auferet Dominus Deus in conspectu vestro gentes magnas et robustissimas, et nullus vobis resistere poterit.

verses.textEn: One of you shall pursue a thousand men of the enemies. For the Lord your God himself will fight on your behalf, just as he promised.
verses.textLa: Unus e vobis persequetur hostium mille viros: quia Dominus Deus vester pro vobis ipse pugnabit, sicut pollicitus est.

verses.textEn: Even so, be very diligent and careful in this: that you love the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Hoc tantum diligentissime præcavete, ut diligatis Dominum Deum vestrum.

verses.textEn: But if you choose to cling to the errors of these nations that live among you, and to mix with them by marriage, and to join with them by friendship,
verses.textLa: Quod si volueritis gentium harum, quæ inter vos habitant, erroribus adhærere, et cum eis miscere connubia, atque amicitias copulare:

verses.textEn: even now, know this: that the Lord your God will not wipe them away before your face. Instead, they shall be a pit and a snare to you, and a stumbling block at your side, and stakes in your eyes, until he takes you away and scatters you from this excellent land, which he has delivered to you.
verses.textLa: iam nunc scitote quod Dominus Deus vester non eas deleat ante faciem vestram, sed sint vobis in foveam ac laqueum, et offendiculum ex latere vestro, et sudes in oculis vestris, donec vos auferat atque disperdat de Terra hac optima, quam tradidit vobis.

verses.textEn: Lo, today I am entering the way of the entire earth, and you shall know with all your mind that, out of all the words that the Lord has promised to fulfill for you, not one will pass by unfulfilled.
verses.textLa: En ego hodie ingredior viam universæ terræ, et toto animo cognoscetis quod de omnibus verbis, quæ se Dominus præstiturum vobis esse pollicitus est, unum non præterierit incassum.
verses.notes: The way of the entire earth is death, since all living things die.

verses.textEn: Therefore, just as he has fulfilled in deed what he has promised, and all prosperous things have arrived, so will he bring upon you whatever evils were threatened, until he takes you away and scatters you from this excellent land, which he has delivered to you,
verses.textLa: Sicut ergo implevit opere quod promisit, et prospera cuncta venerunt: sic adducet super vos quidquid malorum comminatus est, donec vos auferat atque disperdat de Terra hac optima, quam tradidit vobis,

verses.textEn: when you will have transgressed the covenant of the Lord your God, which he has formed with you, and will have served strange gods, and will have adored them. And then the fury of the Lord will rise up quickly and speedily against you, and you will be taken away from this excellent land, which he has delivered to you.”
verses.textLa: eo quod præterieritis pactum Domini Dei vestri, quod pepigit vobiscum, et servieritis diis alienis, ad adoraveritis eos: cito atque velociter consurget in vos furor Domini, et auferemini ab hac Terra optima, quam tradidit vobis.

verses.textEn: And Joshua gathered together all the tribes of Israel at Shechem, and he called those greater by birth, and the leaders and judges and teachers. And they stood in the sight of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Congregavitque Iosue omnes tribus Israel in Sichem, et vocavit maiores natu, ac principes, et iudices, et magistros: steteruntque in conspectu Domini:

verses.textEn: And he spoke to the people in this way: “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: ‘Your fathers lived, in the beginning, across the river: Terah, the father of Abraham, and Nahor. And they served strange gods.
verses.textLa: et ad populum sic locutus est: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israel: Trans fluvium habitaverunt patres vestri ab initio, Thare pater Abraham, et Nachor: servieruntque diis alienis.

verses.textEn: Then I brought your father Abraham from the parts of Mesopotamia, and I led him into the land of Canaan. And I multiplied his offspring,
verses.textLa: Tuli ergo patrem vestrum Abraham de Mesopotamiæ finibus: et adduxi eum in Terram Chanaan: multiplicavique semen eius,

verses.textEn: and I gave to him Isaac. And to him, I gave again Jacob and Esau. And I gave mount Seir to Esau as a possession. Yet truly, Jacob and his sons descended into Egypt.
verses.textLa: et dedi ei Isaac: illique rursum dedi Iacob et Esau. E quibus, Esau dedi montem Seir ad possidendum: Iacob vero, et filii eius descenderunt in Ægyptum.

verses.textEn: And I sent Moses and Aaron, and I struck Egypt with many signs and portents.
verses.textLa: Misique Moysen et Aaron, et percussi Ægyptum multis signis atque portentis.

verses.textEn: And I led you and your fathers away from Egypt, and you arrived at the sea. And the Egyptians pursued your fathers with chariots and horsemen, as far as the Red Sea.
verses.textLa: Eduxique vos et patres vestros de Ægypto, et venistis ad mare: persecutique sunt Ægyptii patres vestros cum curribus et equitatu, usque ad Mare Rubrum.

verses.textEn: Then the sons of Israel cried out to the Lord. And he stationed a darkness between you and the Egyptians, and he led the sea over them, and he covered them. Your eyes saw all that I did in Egypt, and you lived in the wilderness for a long time.
verses.textLa: Clamaverunt autem ad Dominum filii Israel: qui posuit tenebras inter vos et Ægyptios, et adduxit super eos mare, et operuit eos. Viderunt oculi vestri cuncta quæ in Ægypto fecerim, et habitastis in solitudine multo tempore:

verses.textEn: And I led you into the land of the Amorite, who was living beyond the Jordan. And when they fought against you, I delivered them into your hands, and you possessed their land, and you put them to death.
verses.textLa: et introduxi vos in Terram Amorrhæi, qui habitabat trans Iordanem. Cumque pugnarent contra vos, tradidi eos in manus vestras, et possedistis Terram eorum, atque interfecistis eos.

verses.textEn: Then Balak, the son of Zippor, the king of Moab, rose up and fought against Israel. And he sent and called for Balaam, the son of Beor, so that he might curse you.
verses.textLa: Surrexit autem Balac filius Sephor rex Moab, et pugnavit contra Israelem. Misitque et vocavit Balaam filium Beor, ut malediceret vobis:

verses.textEn: And I was not willing to listen to him, but on the contrary, I blessed you through him, and I freed you from his hand.
verses.textLa: et ego nolui audire eum, sed econtrario per illum benedixi vobis, et liberavi vos de manu eius.

verses.textEn: And you crossed over the Jordan, and you arrived at Jericho. And the men of that city fought against you: the Amorite, and the Perizzite, and the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Girgashite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite. And I delivered them into your hands.
verses.textLa: Transistisque Iordanem, et venistis ad Iericho. Pugnaveruntque contra vos viri civitatis eius, Amorrhæus, et Pherezæus, et Chananæus, et Hethæus, et Gergezæus, et Hevæus, et Iebusæus: et tradidi illos in manus vestras.

verses.textEn: And I sent wasps before you. And I drove them from their places, the two kings of the Amorites, but not by your sword, and not by your bow.
verses.textLa: Misique ante vos crabrones: et eieci eos de locis suis, duos reges Amorrhæorum, non in gladio nec in arcu tuo.

verses.textEn: And I gave you a land, in which you did not labor, and cities, which you did not build, so that you might live in them, and vineyards and olive groves, which you did not plant.’
verses.textLa: Dedique vobis Terram, in qua non laborastis, et urbes quas non ædificastis, ut habitaretis in eis: vineas et oliveta, quæ non plantastis.

verses.textEn: Now therefore, fear the Lord, and serve him with a perfect and very sincere heart. And take away the gods that your fathers served in Mesopotamia and in Egypt, and serve the Lord.
verses.textLa: Nunc ergo timete Dominum, et servite ei perfecto corde atque verissimo: et auferte deos, quibus servierunt patres vestri in Mesopotamia et in Ægypto, ac servite Domino.

verses.textEn: But if it seems evil to you that you would serve the Lord, a choice is given to you. Choose today what pleases you, and whom you ought to serve above all else, either the gods that your fathers served in Mesopotamia, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you live: but as for me and my house, we will serve the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Sin autem malum vobis videtur ut Domino serviatis, optio vobis datur: eligite hodie quod placet, cui servire potissimum debeatis, utrum diis, quibus servierunt patres vestri in Mesopotamia, an diis Amorrhæorum, in quorum Terra habitatis: ego autem et domus mea serviemus Domino.

verses.textEn: And the people responded, and they said: “Far be it from us that we would forsake the Lord, and serve foreign gods.
verses.textLa: Responditque populus, et ait: Absit a nobis ut relinquamus Dominum, et serviamus diis alienis.

verses.textEn: The Lord our God himself led us and our fathers away from the land of Egypt, from the house of servitude. And he accomplished immense signs in our sight, and he preserved us along the entire way by which we journeyed, and among all the people through whom we passed.
verses.textLa: Dominus Deus noster ipse eduxit nos, et patres nostros de Terra Ægypti, de domo servitutis: fecitque videntibus nobis signa ingentia, et custodivit nos in omni via, per quam ambulavimus, et in cunctis populis, per quos transivimus.

verses.textEn: And he cast out all the nations, the Amorite, the inhabitant of the land that we entered. And so, we will serve the Lord, for he is our God.”
verses.textLa: Et eiecit universas gentes, Amorrhæum habitatorem Terræ, quam nos intravimus. Serviemus igitur Domino, quia ipse est Deus noster.

verses.textEn: And Joshua said to the people: “You will not be able to serve the Lord. For he is a holy and powerful God, and he is jealous, and he will not ignore your wickedness and sins.
verses.textLa: Dixitque Iosue ad populum: Non poteritis servire Domino: Deus enim sanctus, et fortis æmulator est, nec ignoscet sceleribus vestris atque peccatis.

verses.textEn: If you leave behind the Lord, and you serve foreign gods, he will turn himself, and he will afflict you, and he will overthrow you, after all the good that he has offered to you.”
verses.textLa: Si dimiseritis Dominum, et servieritis diis alienis, convertet se, et affliget vos, atque subvertet postquam vobis præstiterit bona.

verses.textEn: And the people said to Joshua, “By no means will it be as you are saying, but we will serve the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque populus ad Iosue: Nequaquam ita ut loqueris, erit, sed Domino serviemus.

verses.textEn: And Joshua said to the people, “You yourselves are witnesses, that you have chosen the Lord so that you may serve him.” And they answered, “We are witnesses.”
verses.textLa: Et Iosue ad populum, Testes, inquit, vos estis, quia ipsi elegeritis vobis Dominum ut serviatis ei. Responderuntque: Testes.

verses.textEn: “Now therefore,” he said, “take away strange gods from among yourselves, and incline your hearts to the Lord, the God of Israel.”
verses.textLa: Nunc ergo, ait, auferte deos alienos de medio vestri, et inclinate corda vestra ad Dominum Deum Israel.

verses.textEn: And the people said to Joshua, “We will serve the Lord our God, and we will be obedient to his precepts.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque populus ad Iosue: Domino Deo nostro serviemus, et obedientes erimus præceptis eius.

verses.textEn: Therefore, on that day, Joshua struck a covenant, and he set before the people at Shechem the precepts and the judgments.
verses.textLa: Percussit ergo Iosue in die illo fœdus, et proposuit populo præcepta atque iudicia in Sichem.

verses.textEn: He also wrote all these things in the volume of the law of the Lord. And he took a very great stone, and he stationed it under the oak that was in the Sanctuary of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Scripsit quoque omnia verba hæc in volumine legis Domini: et tulit lapidem pergrandem, posuitque eum subter quercum, quæ erat in Sanctuario Domini:

verses.textEn: And he said to all the people, “Lo, this stone shall be to you as a testimony, which has heard all the words of the Lord that he has spoken to you, lest perhaps, afterward, you might choose to deny it, and to lie to the Lord your God.”
verses.textLa: et dixit ad omnem populum: En lapis iste erit vobis in testimonium quod audierit omnia verba Domini, quæ locutus est vobis: ne forte postea negare velitis, et mentiri Domino Deo vestro.

verses.textEn: And he dismissed the people, each one to their own possession.
verses.textLa: Dimisitque populum, singulos in possessionem suam.

verses.textEn: And after these things, Joshua, the son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died, being one hundred and ten years old.
verses.textLa: Et post hæc mortuus est Iosue filius Nun servus Domini, centum et decem annorum:

verses.textEn: And they buried him within the borders of his possession at Timnath-Serah, which is situated on mount Ephraim, before the northern side of mount Gaash.
verses.textLa: sepelieruntque eum in finibus possessionis suæ in Thamnathsare, quæ est sita in monte Ephraim, a Septentrionali parte montis Gaas.

verses.textEn: And Israel served the Lord during all the days of Joshua, and of the elders who lived for a long time after Joshua, and who had known all the works of the Lord that he had accomplished in Israel.
verses.textLa: Servivitque Israel Domino cunctis diebus Iosue et seniorum, qui longo vixerunt tempore post Iosue, et qui noverunt omnia opera Domini quæ fecerat in Israel.

verses.textEn: And the bones of Joseph, which the sons of Israel had brought from Egypt, they buried at Shechem, in a portion of the field that Jacob had purchased from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem, for one hundred young female sheep, and so it was in the possession of the sons of Joseph.
verses.textLa: Ossa quoque Ioseph, quæ tulerant filii Israel de Ægypto, sepelierunt in Sichem, in parte agri, quem emerat Iacob a filiis Hemor patris Sichem, centum novellis ovibus, et fuit in possessionem filiorum Ioseph.

verses.textEn: Likewise, Eleazar, the son of Aaron, died. And they buried him at Gibeah, which belongs to Phinehas, his son, and which was given to him on mount Ephraim.
verses.textLa: Eleazar quoque filius Aaron mortuus est: et sepelierunt eum in Gabaath Phinees filii eius, quæ data est ei in monte Ephraim.
